Beer Names: The Kernel Biere de Saison - Cider Apple
Reviews: På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Gusjegrågul. Kritthvit filmskum. Eplearoma. Smaken epleskall. Tørr. Mere cider enn øl.
Sampled at BKL2020. Nice fruity hop nose, cloudy dark yellow, white lace, mellow medium body, dry fruits, fresh, lychee citruspeel. Nice.
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Ultramørk rødbrun / svart. Filmskum med et lite rødskjær. Tydelig bæraroma. Smaken overmodne plommer. Tørr avslutning.

Beer Names: Freigeist / Hertl Braumanufaktur / Schorschbräu 6 Fäuste für ein Halleluja
Reviews: Sample at BKL2020. Dark brown, brown cream. Umami and Chocolate, chewy, praline, good roast. solid like Bud Spencer.
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Lys gyldengul. Filmskum. Aroma av sitrusfrukt & vanilje. Smaken klementin & plommer. Lett tørr avslutning.

Beer Names: Bitburger / Sierra Nevada Triple Hop'd Lager
Reviews: Tap at BKL2020. Leafy green light spice, medium mellow, light butter, grain, croissant, leafy hops, a hint copper. very fresh and  pleasant.
Tap at BKL2020, slightly aged sample. Dark Amber, golden cream, light oxidized grainy, medium light metal, oxide, grain finish.
Can.  Very hazy thick golden pour with a white head.  Aromas of mixed tropical fruits and citrus hops.  Tastes of the mixed tropical fruits and the citrus hops.  Low bitterness.
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Gylden. Filmskum. Ferskenaroma. Smaken balansert. En del sitrus. Litt malt. Lett tørr fruktig avslutning.

330ml Can from Lidl, N. Ireland (£1.19):
Clear amber with a 0.5cm bubbly head that covers the surface well. There's pale malts & an earthy, bitter aroma that has a biscuit backing. It tastes lighter & fresher with citrus, earthy malts again & grassy flavours coming through but it's not particularly strong. The body is light-medium & crisp with a bitter tang at the end & generally its quite sharp & dry.

Bottle split at Cotts Convention V, from a trade, 08/06/19.
Black with a decent tan covering.
Nose is maple syrup, chocolate, sweet malts, light spice, coffee bean.
Taste comprises chocolate, marsh mallow, coffee, dark malts, toffee.
Medium plus bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a gentle rising boost.
Decent if not top draw ... drinks easy for 14%!

330ml Can from Lidl, N. Ireland (£1.19):
Dark, almost caramel amber with a thin, foamy white head. Its had a mild hop bitterness on the nose with subdued citrus, earthy malts & a strange sweetness at the end. The taste is more bitter with caramel malts, pine & citrus hops with a touch of grapefruit too. It's medium bodied, bitter & well-carbonated but the nose was a little light.
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Ultramørkebrun / svart. Lavt luftig skum med litt farge. Aroma av røstet malt & eik. Smaken kakao. Tørr. Ekstra tørr avslutning.
Nicely to style, creamy, good body, a bit oxidized, but the flavors there are great. GBBF Winter
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Gylden. Luftig filmskum. Lett plommearoma. Smaken aprikos. Tørr bitter avslutning.
Drank as real cask ale at GBBF winter. It’s super cloudy, oxidized, a bit harsh.
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Gylden. Luftig filmskum. Lett honningaroma. Smaken litt fersken. Tynn. Lett tørr avslutning.
Great peanut butter aroma. The taste is very mild peanut butter though, light body, but creamy. GBBF Winter

På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Lys gylde På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Lys gylden. Filmskum. Aroma av melon & sitrusfrukt. Smaken tynn. Litt sitrus. Ellers lite. Tørr avslutning.

Beer Names: Two By Two American Pale Ale
Reviews: På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Appelsinfarget. Uklar. Luftig filmskum. Klementinaroma. Smaken som aromaen. Litt syrlighet i avslutninga. Uvariert.
Tastes a bit oxidized, a bit one dimensional. But it’s drinkable, the fruit is subtle. GBBF Winter real ale cask
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Svart. Lavt lysebrunt skum. Aroma av vanilje & lakris. Smaken melkesjokolade. Tørr avslutning dominert av kakao & vanilje. Litt uvariert.
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Svart. Lavt luftig skum med farge, Forsiktig kaffearoma. Smaken fin mix av kaffe & sjokolade. Melkesjokolade i avslutning. Yummy!
Sampled @ Braukunst Live 2020. A black beer with a beige lacing. Aroma of sweet coffee beans, dark roasted malt. Taste of fresh roasted coffee beans, vanilla. Nice!
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Svart. Luftig skumring med litt farge. Lakrisaroma. Smaken mørke plommer. Tørr. Litt kirsebær i avslutning.
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Amber. Lavt luftig skum. Uklar. Bananaroma. Smaken syrlig. Litt gjær., Litt sitrusfrukt. Lett tørr avslutning.
31-01-20 // taster at Braukunst Live! in Munich. Lovely coffee aromas. Rich in taste and fullbodied. Rum not so really present. But I do like it.
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Svart. Luftig filmskum med farge. God lakrisaroma. Smaken mest lakris. Litt sjokolade. Kakao i avslutninga.
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Mørk gylden. Syltynt filmskum. Tung bæraroma. Smaken overmoden fersken. Lett tørr syrlig bitter avslutning.
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Gyldenbrun. Skumring med litt farge. Vinøs bæraroma. Søt. Smaken tørket frukt. Alkoholen merkes i en tørr ettersmak.

På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Ultradypbrun/svart- Skumring med litt farge. Aroma av kjeks & kirsebær. Smaken overmoden kirsebær med en varmende tørr bitter avslutning - som varer lenge.
31-01-20 // taster at Braukunst Live! in Munich. Thanks sinh4 for sharing! Oily honey sweet mead with a mild nutmeg spicyness. Soft vanilla. Nice.
31-01-20 // taster at Braukunst Live! in Munich. Thanks sinh4 for sharing. Thicker oily viscosity. Loads of ginger but not in a too overspiced way. Pairs well with the honey sweetness. A great mead.
04-02-20 // 500ml bottle. Thanks to my uncle. Clear darker golden. White head. Grainy sweet with plörrigem Ansatz. A minimal metallic offnote. Not balanced. Not smooth. No from me.

05-02-20 // 500ml on tap at Baron, Mainz.

Quite sweet Pils. Grainy. Lower bitterness.
05-02-20 // 500ml bottle at Baron, Mainz. Pours unclear darker brown. Beige to brown head. Average Dunkelweizen. Thicker body, light creamy with a mild roasted malt touch.

Tap @Yard Bar Bangkok. Golden colour not completely clear, high whitehead. Aroma of tropical fruits and some floral. Taste yeasty, apricot, passionfruit, soft piney finish. Mouthfeel is yeasty tecture to me. Light body.

05-02-20 // 500ml bottle at Baron, Mainz. Pours unfiltered golden with a solid hwite head. Grainy sweet. Light Ale character with a big thicker body than when expecting a bavarian Helles. Sort of an hybrid between Helles and Golden Ale? Grainy smooth.
31-01-20 // taster at Braukunst Live!  2019 version. 6,5%. 12 Monate gerefit. Rich malty with solid mild whiskey notes. Caramel malty sweetness. Mild vanilla.
31-01-20 // taster at Braukunst Live! Schon gut. Chocolate cherry, Schwarzwald gateau vibes without being too sweet. More of a darker bitter chocolate aroma. Good.
31-01-20 // taster at Braukunst Live! Unclear golden. Wheat malts and wheaty yeast aromas along a floral aroma. Average.

Beer Names: Testbräu Sorachi Blanche Himbeere Cider Edition
Reviews: 31-01-20 // taster at Braukunst Live! From a bottle. Pours unclear pinkish red. Distinct cider yeast aromas in the nose along a raspberry aroma. Good fruity sourness and well embedded yeast aromas.

I have purchased this beer, at Wittisch Getränk market, at Olten. Drinking and enjoying this bottle yesterday after the birthday of my daughter. The body is copper/brown and a bit troubled, average carbonation, a bit crispy, white foam. In my point of view, it is an interesting ipa, you have probably a touch of citra, mineral, hay, side of tobacco, touch of lychee, fruity and dry, malt, hoppy and citrus.

375 mL bottle. Pours yellow and a little hazy. Smells of, amazingly, pilsner malt right up front. White wine behind it, and very sauvignon blanc-y. Tastes of sharp white wine acidity. Oak. Pilsner malt is still there, but lost to acidity and white wine. Medium body. The layers are a little muddled on the palate, at least by comparison to how discrete they are on the nose.

Nice deep brown color to it with some reddish highlights, pours with three fingers of light brown colored, rocky looking head that has a good retention to it that leaves a nice skim on the surface of the glass, leaves no lacing but has some slight legs running down the sides. 

Fairly sweet aroma to it of dark fruits and syrup with hints of spices and brandy that give a slight fruitcake impression.

Forward is fairly malty and quite sweet, medium/ heavy bodied with a slightly above average amount of carbonation to it and a nice toffee flavor to it with a solid mouthfeel, as well as a light fruity reduced grape note almost a bit like ice wine with faint hints of honey, dates and, trace of plum and rum raisin. 

Back end has spicy hints of black pepper, cayenne and cloves as well as a lightly leafy, tobacco hop note and a sweet brandy finish with a whisper of heat to it leaving a lingering sweet toffee, raisin and tobacco aftertaste to it and a slight boozy warmth spreading out to the limbs.

500 mL bottle. Pours clear and very pale yellow. Smells of soft doughy malt and light spicy hop. Tastes of bready and lightly sweet dough. Light spicy hops throughout but I keep expecting it to peak with a spicy bite, but never does. Very light. It hints a hefty hop back end it but drops off in favor of a delicate malt flavor.

440ml can brewed in England at 4.3%. Sheer pastel orange with a picturesque head, decent duration. Orange juice aromas with some mango undertones and perhaps a hint of grapefruit. Lowish carbonation. Primarily orange-juicy, helped by the mouthfeel, with a pale malt serving to add very slight, gentle pithiness. Some slight mango tropical tints too. Smooth, sweet, bland in a good way - it's a bit like vanilla - sure it's plain, but who doesn't like vanilla? Especially well done vanilla. This is well done vanilla. Classic easy-drinker with classic hops, and just has that touch of class in how it's all put together that makes this absolutely, evidently craft and not supermarket fare. Balance of bitter and sweet is spot on too. I've had a lot of craft Pales that didn't quite meet the mark set here in sheer execution. But still, it's vanilla. Don't expect the world and this will do right by your tastebuds.

Bottle split at Cotts Convention V, T Hanks, 08/06/19.
Pale golden blonde with a decent off white cap.
Nose is grass, pale malts, straw, papery twang.
Taste comprises pale malts, cereals, grains, pretty basic all round.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Sub par even for a PLCS (pale lager country scope).

Bottle split at Cotts Convention V, picked up at the previous years GBBF IIRC, 08/06/19.
Hazed golden orange with a well presented off white covering.
Nose is peach, grass, yeast esters, breads, hint of bubblegum.
Taste comprises apricot, Belgian yeast esters, grape must, straw, candied fruit rinds, peach, green berry tang.
Medium plus bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Decent.

Dark, Clean, Tan Beerhead, with thin, frothy, and lacing foam. OK retention. Having hoppy flavors and roasted malts characters at the same time, great balance between them, and different performances from cold to ambient temperature. Like coffee, toffee, plums, dark caramel, and slightly vanilla hints on the tasting. On the other hand, grapefruit, pine and  tropical fruits in the smell.
Aroma : Toasted caramel malts with a grassy hop undertone.  Taste : Toasted sweet caramel malts up front, balanced by soft bittering hop finish. Better than average Irish Red (Florida tour Nov 2018)

Cask conditioned at GBBF Winter, New Bingley Hall, Hockley, Birmingham. Very dark brown with cream head. There is a pleasing fruitiness to this porter, dark roasted malts with a bitter nuttiness, some chocolate. Sweet in the close. Decent beer.

Cask conditioned at GBBF Winter, New Bingley Hall, Hockley, Birmingham. Amber with white head. Cannot believe I hadn't had this before but glad I came across it now. Full and hoppy in character, orange bitterness, peel and zest, citrusy, grapefruit juice flavours. Good depth of flavour, hides the ABV well. A cracker.

Beer Names: Ancient City Anastasia Island Style IPA
Reviews: Aroma : Notes of caramel & bready malt, citrus orange, grapefruit & some pine.  Taste : Lightly sweet caramel malt nicely balanced by bitter citrus. Not special but easily drinkable (Florida tour Nov 2018)

Hazy golden appearance with a white head. Aroma of mango, zesty hops, mild citrus and light cereal/grain. Similar flavor, adding mild bitterness and mild sweetness with a hint of cinnamon at the finish. Interesting.

Cask conditioned at GBBF Winter, New Bingley Hall, Hockley, Birmingham. Very dark brown with cream head. There are sour notes in this from the off, acidic lactose with soured plum flavours, damson notes. The darker roasted malts do come through, some nutty hints. Not sure about sour porter but this is fine.
Light lemon colour with white head, typical lager profile with some minor spice on the nose. A crisp lager that’s easy to drink, not a fan of the herbal/spice thing through the palate

Cask conditioned at GBBF Winter, New Bingley Hall, Hockley, Birmingham. Gold with white head. There is a light fruitiness to this, malt lead, lightly grainy then tropical fruit hopped notes. Pineapple and Mango flavours. Easy on the palate. Pretty reasonable.

Cask conditioned at GBBF Winter, New Bingley Hall, Hockley, Birmingham. Gold with white head. There is a hoppy character to this, quite light on the palate, reasonably tangy, hint of bitterness. It's fine.

Beer Names: Ancient City Matanzas River Red Ale
Reviews: Aroma : Medium toast and sweet nutty malt with light earthy hops.  Taste : Toasted semi-sweet malt nicely balance by some earthy hop. Slightly dry bitter astringent finish. Better than average Irish Red (Florida tour Nov 18)

Beer Names: Ancient City Drink It Down Pecan Nut Brown
Reviews: Aroma : Toasty malts with hints of chocolate, caramel, cookies & nut.   Taste : Thin body leading to thin caramel malt taste, not picking up much else. Very average…Lacks depth (Florida tour Nov 18)

Cask conditioned at GBBF Winter, New Bingley Hall, Hockley, Birmingham. Gold with white head. There is a light fruitiness to this with  a pleasant fruity, dry hopped note. The ginger came through qute late for me but was more obvious for others on the table. Drying in the close. Pretty reasonable.
Clear ruby appearance with a beige head. Tart, fruity and floral with pleasant sweetness and mild acidity. Light body with a smooth feel and a slightly dry finish. Good.

Cask conditioned at GBBF Winter, New Bingley Hall, Hockley, Birmingham. Very dark brown with cream head. There is a reasonably rich roasty character to this initially then a fruity flavour. Sweet cherry hints, lactose, chocolate ice cream. There is a bitterness in the close. Good.

Beer Names: Ancient City Augustine's Orange Amber Ale
Reviews: Aroma : Light caramel malt, unusual sweet orange note rather than citrus orange.  Taste : Malt is sublte, sweet orange comes through and although not overpowring, for me lacks some bittering balance. Still an o.k. beer though (Florida tour Nov 2018)
# 1170; 8/2018. Na Kristallweizen vynikající pivo. Čiré, slámové, s bohatou pěnou a plnou, velmi kořeněnou, typickou pšeničnou chutí.
# 1169; 8/2018. Výborně pojatej tmavej ležák. Bez náznaku zbytečný sladkosti, pěkně nahořklej, praženej, čokoládovej. Moc povedený.

Cask conditioned at GBBF Winter, New Bingley Hall, Hockley, Birmingham. Very dark brown with cream head. There is a sweetish fruity, plummy flavour to this from the off, rich and flavoursome on the palate. Lasting through the beer, hints of chocolate and liquorice. Very pleasant.

Cask conditioned at GBBF Winter, New Bingley Hall, Hockley, Birmingham. Very dark brown with beige head. There is a sweet fruitiness to this from the off becoming fairly tangy later. Some earthy roasted malt notes. Biggish on the palate. Reasonable.

Cloudy dark gold pour with a one finger white head. Aroma of toast and tropical fruit, coconut, light caramel, sweet citrus. Flavor is mostly the same with some earthy floral and toasty sesame notes. Medium body, slick to syrupy feel, moderate hop acid bite. Pretty good.

Cask conditioned at GBBF Winter, New Bingley Hall, Hockley, Birmingham. Amber with white head. There is a light toffee caramel character to this from the start. Reasonably dry, malty with an earthy, twiggy hopped note. It's fine.

Cask conditioned at GBBF Winter, New Bingley Hall, Hockley, Birmingham. Gold with white head. There is a honeyed note in the aroma which passes through into the beer, syrupy, slightly flabby in character. Thinnish bitterness late on. It's okay.

Very dark red-brown, faint ruby highlights, mocha head. The aroma is dark malt sugars, not too sweet, lots of cooked corn upfront, a little alcohol. The dms goes away after a while, leaving room for more malts. The taste quite sweet and malty, dark caramel and maltose, with a touch of roast barley, some hop spice and warming alcohol. Not bad, despite the bucket loads of dms, not a stout... Otherwise a decent malț forward dark beer.

Can bought at BCL in June 2019, $3.60 CAD.
Attack: crisp creamy bite
Mids: sweet light bready-grainy barley malt, lvl5-sweetness, light metallic hops
Finish: subtle bitter hops
Overall: excellent balanced sweet barley malts, very nice mouthfeel, smooth drinking.

Cask conditioned at GBBF Winter, New Bingley Hall, Hockley, Birmingham. Pale gold with white head. This proved to be a malt lead beer, bitter and dry from the start, grainy cereal notes, quite earthy in flavour. Easy on the palate. It's fine.

Black pour with a thin tan head. Aroma of Chai spice, toast, roasted nuts, Strawberry hard candy, light floral notes and Karo syrup. Flavor is gooey burnt cinnamon rolls, nondescript fruity notes, chocolate, dark caramel. Heavy body, syrupy, gloopy feel, light, sharp carbonation. Decent, lots of conflicting stuff going on, but it works.

Bottle thanks to Mike J. Pours a pitch black hue with a small white head. A roast and cocoa nose, light wood. Rich, vanilla, very woody, tannins, sweet tobacco, dark fruit, light minerals, licorice, slick palate. Very nice.

Beer Names: Lion Bridge The Spice Must Flow
Reviews: Cloudy, near black pour with a thin, creamy tan head. Aroma of Chai spice, lactose, chocolate, and light roast. Flavor is nutmeg heavyweight Chai, earth, walnut, a hint of cocoa and black tea. Medium body medium carbonation slightly syrupy, kinda gloopy feel. Pretty good, but it's all spice.

Cloudy golden appearance with a fluffy white head. Aroma of juicy hops, fresh citrus, mild tropical notes and a light zesty spice. Similar flavor, adding mild to moderate hop bitterness and some juicy sweetness. Medium plus body with a smooth citrusy finish. Nice.

Poured from a 500 ml bottle. 
Aroma is rather floral with light pepper and honey notes. Light grain notes and faint honey notes. 
Pours a fairly clear, brilliant gold with a large, thick, pillowy, white head that recedes steadily to a small film that lingers. Moderately high lacing and no legs. 
Flavor is a bit of an odd blend of acidic and sweet with medium light malt notes; it alternates between sweet and sour. Medium bitterness. Moderately strong floral notes with light elderberry notes. Faint honey.
Mouthfeel is light bodied with medium high carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, an odd beer but a somewhat enjoyable one as well. Nice floral notes with light elderberry and a bit of acidity.

Beer Names: Wicked Weed Dark Age Stout (Bourbon Stout)
Reviews: Tastes of dried fruit, chocolate, a hint of coffee. Some bourbon and vanilla in the aftertaste. Thiccc with three Cs. Outstanding.

Beer Names: New Belgium Voodoo Ranger American Haze
Reviews: Cloudy burnt orange pour with a one finger creamy white head. Aroma of bread, berry, candied citrus, spruce and sharp mineral notes. Flavor is sweet citrus, bready malt, light toast and mineral notes. Light body, lightly chalky feel, light carbonation. Ok.
Spritzy nose with some breadiness. Some estey notes as it warms up and breathes. Medium body with some sweetness and a moderate bitterness. Clean finish. Very drinkable, but nothing jumps out at me.

Clear golden appearance with a white head. Aroma of toasted grain, mild strawberry and a light herbal spice. Similar flavor, grainy and fruity with mild sweetness and light bitterness. Light body with a slight watery feel and a lingering berry finish.
Aroma is berries, apples and mild/medium sweetness.  The flavor is berries/slight soda, apples and a medium sweet finish.

Poured from a 16 oz can. 
Aroma is malt forward with lots of grain, cracker, biscuit and toasted bread notes. Light herbal, spicy hop notes with hints of floral character. 
Pours a slightly hazy, brilliant gold color with a large, thick, frothy, white head that recedes slowly to a small film that lingers a bit on the edges. Moderately high lacing and no legs. 
Flavor is somewhat sweet with moderately strong grain notes of bread, cracker, and biscuit. Moderately strong bitterness with medium light hop notes of woody, herbal and spicy notes with faint floral character and a hint of fruit esters. 
Mouthfeel is light bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a pretty enjoyable lager. Nice malt notes with assertive bitterness and hop notes. Hop notes and bitterness are not too strong though and malt is still center stage.

Clear golden appearance with a lingering white head. Aroma of zesty hops, toasted grain and light tropical notes. Similar flavor, adding mild to moderate bitterness and light sweetness. Light body with a slight watery finish.

Draught. Pours clear black with a medium, frothy beige head, short retention. Moderate roast and coffee malt, light hop bitterness, dark fruits, and a dry finish. Medium-full body and medium carbonation.

Hazy orange to pale amber pour with a one finger white head. Aroma of sweet juicy and candied citrus, light sweet bread, light pineapple-heavyweight tropical fruit. Flavor is citrus and floral up front some pine, a little pineapple and yeasty bread. Light to medium body, chalky, medium sharp carbonation. I like it, although it seems unnaturally sweet.

Beer Names: Sunriver Cinder Beast Imperial Red Ale
Reviews: Draught. Pours clear amber with a medium, frothy off-white head, short retention leaving only a cordon. Moderate fruity and citrus hops, moderate hop bitterness, medium toast and biscuit malt, and a dry finish. Medium-full body and medium carbonation.

Draught. Pours clear amber with a medium, frothy off-white head, long retention with good lacing. Moderate dank, earthy, and woody hops, moderate hop bitterness, medium toast malt, and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Draught. Pours hazy dark orange with a large, frothy white head, long retention with excellent lacing. Heavy fruity and floral hops, moderate hop bitterness, medium grainy and bready malt, and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Draught. Pours clear brown with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention with good lacing. Moderate rich bready, biscuit, and toasted grain malt, dark fruits, and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Draught. Pours clear dark gold with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention with good lacing. Medium rich bready malt, sulfur notes, medium floral and spicy hops, medium hop bitterness, and a dry finish. Light body and moderate carbonation.

473ml can. Pours a hazy copper with a medium, creamy, short lived, tan head that laces nicely. Aroma of bready wheat malt, banana, clove and yeast. Sweet flavour of toasted bready wheat malt, caramel, clove, fig, yeast and a hint of nuts in a dry, mild bitter finish. Medium body with a smooth, oily texture and average carbonation. Malt forward and tasty. Pretty solid.

Apparence : Dorée, claire, col blanc moyen bien aéré, carbonatation moyenne.    
Nez : Malt, pain frais.  
Goût : Malt et pain accompagnés d'un houblon qui tangue entre les notes feuillues et celles d'agrumes. Peu sucrée, amertume douce.   
Sensation : Mince, effervescence moyenne, arrière-goût associé au houblon décrit plus haut.   
Bref : Peut-être un problème de fraîcheur, mais ni le malt ni le houblon (ni leur agencement, il va sans dire) ne me convainc ici. Dans les bières douces et faciles à boire, je conseillerais probablement d'autres avant celle-ci.

Pours thick black with thin, tan head. Aroma is coconut, cocoa, vanilla and roast. Taste is chocolate and lactose, moving to coconut, vanilla and roast. Finish is chocolate, coconut, vanilla and roast. Tasty stout.
Hazy orange with a white head. Aroma is juicy with tropical fruit, mango, melon, pineapple. Medium bodied, juicy, quaffable, nice hazy.

Beer Names: New Belgium Voodoo Ranger Starship IPA
Reviews: Cloudy pale orange pour with a two finger creamy white head that has good retention. Aroma of toast, sesame, sweet citrus and light Mango and guava. Flavor is mostly the same with a little cat box and pine. Light to medium body slightly chalky feel, light carbonation. Pretty good

Beer Names: Tired Hands The Love You Feel Is The Love You Hear
Reviews: A big New England style IPA, brewed with Mosaic, New Zealand Cascade, Gringeist, and Barbe Rouge.  Let's hear it for hops no one has heard of before.  The pretty label has lots of flowers on it.  Flavorful and complex - pine, marmalade, and pineapple.  It is not too fruity tho, with earthy notes, oregano, and blue Gatorade.  Pleasant but not too strong in the nostrils.  Another good IPA from TH.

Can from the LCBO that pours a clean, dark amber colour with a frothy light beige head, good stay and some spotted foam lace is left. Caramel malt aromas with some dark fruit notes, nuttiness and mild hops. These hops show a little more in the taste, blended with the caramel base and some roasted malts. Fairly hoppy-bitterness for a lager, especially a dark one. Again, some dark fruits and hints of molasses. Quite decent for the style.

Can from Bottles in Providence, RI.  Bright amber-gold with a thin, coarse white head and fairly poor retention.  Nothing left after a minute or so.  Aroma is a nice lightly lager-sour and grainy lager smell.  a touch musty and a touch copper metallic (in a pleasant way), corn.  Body is medium-medium-light weight, syrupy, with medium-medium-light carbonation and burn, fairly fine on the palate, velvety.  Flavor is pretty robust, lightly lager-sour, getting very faint hints of spices, a bit of grain and light sweetness with some metallic grass notes too.  Aroma is very nice here, the taste is fine.  Better than I was expecting!
So I have no idea what hibiscus tastes like, so I don't know if I'm getting any, but this beer is bone dry with a bit of spice and some barnyard, which is what I expect from a saison.

Beer Names: Martin House Best Maid Sour Pickle Beer
Reviews: Pours a mostly clear yellow color with a thick off white head. The aroma is pickle juice and some tartness. The flavor is overpowering sour pickle juice. There is some tartness and saltiness in there as well. Very much a gimmick beer and worth a try.
Aroma is cranberries/orange and almost fruit wine.  The flavor is fruit/orange/cranberries, malts a puckering tart/very dry finish.

From can to pint glass.  Aromas of citrus and lemon.  Slight grainy malt.  Crystal clear pale yellow with sustained, small white head.  Beautiful beer.  Flavor is lemon cake and slight curd.  Dry finish, follows through to a nice carbonic bite.  Very good beer.

Draught. Pours clear black with brown highlights and a medium, frothy beige head, short retention. Moderate rich chocolate and coffee, light nuttiness, and a medium dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.
Draught. Pours clear dark brown with a medium, frothy off-white head, short retention. Medium rich toasted bread malt, cinnamon, vanilla, and cocoa with a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Poured from 12 oz. bottle. 

Clear, bright yellow with a 2-finger near white head and good lacing. 

Aroma of white grapes, a strange citrus-like aroma I don’t recognize and exotic tropical fruit. 

Taste follows the nose closely.  

Medium body and medium carbonation. 

This has a distinctive hopping that is nothing like anything I’ve experienced before. I welcome the addition to the brewmaster’s pallet, but I find this beer is a little too grapey for my taste.
Can part of mixer I bought for family. Fine brown pour. Tastes earthy, caramel, nuts, malt. Thinner

Real dark brown colour with a little copper highlights. The head is mocha-coloured with bubble around the rim and little spotted lacing. Cocoa powder aromas blended with coconut and other chocolate notes. The taste is pretty rich, but not too thick, so goes down nicely. Roasted, chocolate malts with coffee hints. Fairly dry finish, bitterness lingering a bit with a tad peanut butter. Even though not as sweet dessert as their other 10% ABV Imperial Sweet Stouts, still loaded with beautiful ingredients. Starting to feel the peanut butter more and more, which seems to be what is blending things.
Draught. Pours clear gold with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention. Moderate orange and melon hops, medium hop bitterness, medium bread malt, and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Beer Names: Double Mountain / Barley Browns Coyote Sunset IPA
Reviews: Hazy straw body with a thin head. Aroma is lemon zest, orange and grapefruit. Bright and with a zing. Taste is lighter, with orange and lemon zest bitter/sweet mixture. Texture is thin.

Cloudy pale gold pour with a one finger white head. Aroma is very lemony and tart floral. Flavor is juicy lemon-lime citrus, straw, pale malt, wildflower. Light body, dry feel light carbonation. Good stuff, interesting hop profile.

Draught. Pours hazy dark amber with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention. Moderate orange and fruit hops, honeydew and cantaloupe notes, light bread malt, medium hop bitterness and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Beer Names: Le Castor New England India Pale Ale
Reviews: Juicy nose with notes of mango, mandarin, navel orange, pineapple, some more musky floral tropical fruit, fresh leaves and grass, a bit of biscuit malt. Flavour is rather sweet up front, with orange, mango and pineapple again in the lead, a fairly neutral but present biscuit grain base, some moderately green grassy hops and citrus peels and a hint of onion enter in the semi-juicy but drying finish with light to moderate bitterness. Medium bodied, average carbonation, a little creamy. A nicely executed NEIPA, would have liked a little less greenness late in the sip but I enjoy getting this with some regularity.

16 ounce can. Murky mustard gold color. Two finger high frothy beige head. Nice clinging lace. Floral hop nose hints at honeysuckle and sweet citrus. Crackery malt base has a jolt of dank citrus hop flavor. Subtle creamy mouthfeel from the wheat and oats. Bitter peppery finish.

relatively fresh can that pours clear bright gold with a large white head offering good retention and lacing. golden doughy pilsner malts twirling with soft tropical citra, but also peppery and spicy herbal notes surprisingly, super clean yeast action. moderate carbonation, light body - oily; dry citrusy-herbal finish. meant to write noble hops or gtfo, but eh, this is a great new world pilsner.

Draught. Pours hazy orange with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention with good lacing. Moderate orange and dank hops and hop bitterness, medium bread malt, and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

341mL can, pours a hazy golden with a medium white head. Aroma reveals bright floral hops, with some citrus zest, and biscuity malt. Flavour is balanced, with citrus hops, some floral notes, and crisp biscuity malt. Nothing overly interesting, but the balance is good, and there is even a decent hop bite. Better than expected.

Hazy golden colour with a tad orange, a warm cap, average retention and some spotted lace. Orange citrus scent with lots of fruity sweetness, tropical fruits like papaya and even hints of peach. Very smooth and silky mouthfeel. The grassiness is well-hidden from the hops in the taste, with some peppery light notes. The fruitiness does the rest. This is very, very drinkable, very good. Should be one they can, and have all of the time as their standard IPA.

(473ml can from L'Axe du Malt, Quebec City) Pours nearly opauqe yellow-orange with an average white head. Aroma of green mango, melon, papaya, unripe guava, some sweet canned peach and orange undertones, a little leafy. Flavour is off-dry with melon, papaya and green mango most prevalent, some estery kveik fruitiness, light biscuit to the malt, finishing rather dry with quite low bitterness, a little chalky, with lingering melon and fruit peels. Medium bodied, average carbonation. Solid effort, I'd like more expression of the citra here which teases juicy but ends up a bit more on the greener side.

(473ml can from L'Axe du Malt, Quebec City) Pours opaque dingy orange juice with a tight white cap with stability and lace. Aroma of sweet tangerine, dried mango, citrus peels, leafy hops, dank and rather green onion-y, some sweetness. Flavour is semi-sweet up front but with a lot of citrus bitters, leafy greens, melon peels competing with the tropical fruit notes. Finishes bone dry and resinous with a moderate plus bitter bite for style. Light to medium body with soft fairly smooth carbonation. Solid NEIPA but the balance is too far towards the green side for me to truly love this.

(473ml can from Metro St Roch, Quebec City) Pours nearly clear pale gold with a rapidly fizzing head. Simple clean semi-dry cider, fresh lightly sweet and lightly tart Mcintosh apple vibes, slight skin and yeast tones, pretty mineral, dry finish. Light fizzing mouthfeel. Decent enough, bought for cooking and not objectionable to drink half the can.

500ml bottle at home via VA.  Hazy golden orange with a lasting white head and good lacing.  Funky peach, apricot, earth, yeast, mild vinegar and brett.  Medium carb and body, creamy champagne texture.  Lingering funky finish.  Delicious.

orange with white head. alcohol. and alcohol. grain. taste is hot and balanced, tons of just sugar. not bad at all, but a beer with one obvious purpose. wouldnt get again unless i wanted to get drunk and it was placed in front of me
22 oz bomber stamped rel# 55 abv 6.6.  Pours clear golden with foamy white head.  Medium body.  Floral aroma including rosemary and thyme.  Bready and very herbal taste.  Bitter finish.
Pours a hazy, lemon-gold, with smallish head. Aroma has some straw, some dank, stinky cheese. Flavor has straw, citrus, some tropical fruit. A touch chalky. Finish is rather bitter.

Cloudy orange-gold pour with a two finger frothy, off-white head that has great retention. Aroma of citrus, tart and fruity floral and juicy tropical fruit. Flavor is juicy tropical fruit, juicy citrus, a little pale malt, nice fruity esters. Medium body creamy feel, light, blanketing carbonation, just a hint of hop acid bite. Really good.

Beer Names: Deschutes Wowza! Lo-Cal Hazy Pale Ale
Reviews: Light yellow appearance with mild haze and a white head. Aroma of zesty hops, toasted grain and light pineapple. Similar flavor, adding mild hop bitterness and light sweetness. Light and crisp with a refreshing finish. Solid.
Orange pour. Thin foam. Orange and wheat nose. Orange flavor with hops and sour hops palate.
Pencil shavings and orange peel nose. Hazy amber, firm medium head. Clementine, tangerine. Medium body, easy carbonation.

12 ounce can from Niemuth's, 2/5/20. Hazy pale gold, large foamy white head, good retention. Aroma of mango, apricot, leafy hops, pale malt. Taste is pale malt, tropical fruit, a bit of pine. Medium bodied, low bitterness. Indeed crushable. Solid.

Draught. Pours hazy orange with a medium, frothy off-white head, long retention with light lacing. Moderate fresh grassy and herbal hops, medium bread malt, funky Brettanomyces, and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

can.  Poured opaque brown with a beige head. Aroma of sweet candied nuts. Full rich mouthfeel, creamy carbonation, long finish.  Flavour is savory and sweet, almost sickly, nutty and caramel notes, roasty malts. Not bad, but one was enough.

Draught. Pours hazy orange with a large, creamy white head, long retention with good lacing. Moderate lime and orange, medium tartness and acidity, medium bread malt, and a dry finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation.

12 ounce with no bottling date, served at the Hyatt Place bar in Roanoke, VA. Clear orange pour with a film of cream. Nose of honey, orange, toast and a touch of lemon grass. Flavors of orange, toffee, lemon grass and a touch of resin. Smooth, near-medium mouthfeel. Nice, easy drinking balance without much bitterness.
Pours a hazy dark amber from a can, thick white head. Tropical and stone fruit aroma and flavor, nondescript and sweet. Juicy. Good beer.

I guess I forgot to score this. Couldn't make up my mind what to drink and figured this wasn't getting any better. Deep mahogany color with a mall tan head. Aroma of dark sugars, caramel, wood, oak, vanilla, light chocolate. Full bodied, warming, no oxidation even after 4+ years, great sipper.

Beer Names: Cigar City Florida Cracker White Ale
Reviews: Aroma is citrus, banana esters and fresh bread. Taste is light sweet grains, honey, coriander, and clove. Pretty standard expression here.

Beer Names: Mikkeller San Diego Beer Geek Cocoa Shake Bourbon BA
Reviews: Pours inky black like motor oil. Little carb. Big alcoholic nose of toffee, chocolate and tobacco. Flavor is so rich with bourbon and chocolate with a bit of espresso in the back ground coats your mouth and throat in a good way. Decadent beer well worth trying.

12 ounce bottle thanks to hershiser2! Hazy amber, large white head, decent retention. Aroma of bready malt, toasted grain, apricot, spice, yeast, marzipan. Taste is spice, hay, cherry, apricot, yeast. Medium bodied, mild lingering spice. A bit on the sweet side but pretty nice.
Bottle. Pours lightly hazy reddish orange and nearly still. Moderate tart and acidic citrus, medium earthy rosemary, vinous red grapes, earthy, and a dry finish. Medium body and nearly still.
Can. Clear golden. Aroma of apples. Medium sweet, lightly tart. Medium bodied and a little dry.
Looks great with a dark brown body and a tan head. Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate. Taste is bitter cocoa and burnt malt. Coffee too. Texture is thin.
Lactic tartness, some funk, heavy peach notes. Bone dry, no residual sugars here. Good beer.

Beer Names: Northern Monk Northern Star Mocha Porter
Reviews: From explosivedog, thanks: pours blackish with a ruby tinge with a beige head. Aroma is loads of roasted coffee beans, hints of vanilla, chocolate. Taste is sweet, loads of coffee, low bitter. Silky and creamy body, but still quite light. Tasty.

Bottle with much love to Scott, the facilitator of all good things.  Pours a deep, dark brown (thin looking liquid though) with a thin head.  Aromas of leather, charcoal, and coffee.  Flavor is a nice and clean stout with a touch of bourbon, coffee, and smoky charcoal.  Nice and light for a beer with this much flavor.

Beer Names: The Ale Apothecary Carpe Diem Manana
Reviews: Draught. Pours clear dark gold with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention. Medium tart citrus, light acidity, medium bread malt, vinous character, oak, and a dry finish. Medium body and light carbonation.

Beer Names: Sierra Nevada Torpedo Extra IPA - Bourbon Barrel Aged
Reviews: Absolutely delicious. The hoppiness of Torpedo is toned down, but the results are oh so fascinating once this subdued IPA bitterness is coupled with generous barrel aging. The bourbon notes provide a lovely baseline, while subtle grapefruit, orange, and pine notes play off the vanilla and wood from the barrel. Texture's dreamy in its supple smooth feel; ABV's a nonfactor. Just a frickin' amazing beer.

Beer Names: Lewis and Clark Back Country Scottish Ale
Reviews:
(Thanks, Jim! "Ozzy70")

Can.

A- Malty, slightly fruity.

A- Brown color, clear liquid, off white head.

T- Caramel, malty.

P- Medium body, average texture, average carbonation, balanced finish.

O- Not bad but kind of plain. You're not drinking this hoping for the most complex beer of the nice. Decent.
Mossy soil nose. Clear black, thin tan head. Potting soil, charred oak, moss. Medium body, moderate carbonation.

Bottle.

A- Iron, citrus, mild bread dough.

A- Orange copper color, clear liquid, off white head.

T- Medium bitterness, doughy, caramel, mild fruitiness.

P- Medium body, average texture, average carbonation, malty finish.

O- Clearly old. Almost 2 years so. A malt bomb at this point but not terrible. Honestly probably liked it better than if it was fresh.
Dark pour with medium  foam. Sweet chocolate  nose. Sweet taste of chocolate  and coffee with a sweet palate.
Bottle. Pours cloudy orange with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention. Medium earthy spruce, medium bread malt, light salt, tart and acidic with a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.
A good hopped beer, surprisingly drinkable despite at eight weeks.  Can from the source, thanks Brian.

Draught. Pours hazy orange with a small, frothy white head, short retention. Medium tart and acidic citrus, white grapes and vinous, medium bread malt, and a dry finish. Medium body and light carbonation.
Can. Clear golden with whitish colored bubbles. Aroma of honey, apples, and a little agave. Sweet with a hint of tart. Medium bodied with a touch of fizz on the tongue. Well done.

Beer Names: The Ale Apothecary Bergamont La Tache
Reviews: Cask. Pours clear golden orange with a bubbly white head, short retention. Moderate savory bergamot flowers, oregano, light tartness, medium bread malt, and a dry finish. Medium body and light carbonation.

330 ml bottle from the LCBO.  Pours a dark mahogany colour with smallish cream-coloured head.  Aroma is dark cherry with solid oakiness, sourness, toffee and grains.  Flavour has tart dark cherry, moderate oakiness, a little vinegar and toffee.  Medium plus bodied.  Nice.

On tap at Champps in Brookfield. 2019 version! Very dark brown pour. Aroma has sweet barrel, cinnamon, some chiles, sweet malts. Taste is of cinnamon, sweet barrel, cherry, sweet malts, and tangy chiles. Well done and tasty. The chiles provide a solid heat. Medium to full bodied, with some alcohol presence, the blend is good. This does not have the typical Darkness full body, but still solidly supports the barrel & chiles. Unsure how this would age. Lovin the cinnamon/barrel taste blend. Finishes sweetly, with barrel & cinnamon. This has an interesting blend. Multi dimensional with the chiles. Still would like more of the typical Darkness thickness. 16.3

On tap at Champps in Brookfield. 2017 version! Very dark brown pour. Aroma hits with barrel & dark fruits. Taste has barrel, dark fruits, sweet malts. Medium to full bodied, a bit of a surprise for a Darkness brew, the blend is good, and there is a solid alcohol presence. Finishes sweetly with barrel. The barrel is nice. This overall is a bit disappointing add expecting more Darkness body to stand-up more with the barrel. 15

Can (Dec 26, 2019 canning). Head is initially large, frothy, rocky, off-white, mostly lasting. Body is lightly hazy dark yellow to light amber. Aroma is lightly to moderately malty (toasted grain, corn starch), lightly to moderately hoppy (grapefruit pith), with a light note of metal shavings. Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, lightly acidic, moderately bitter. Medium body, velvety/watery texture, lively carbonation.

Certainly among the best NA beers available. Still room for improvement, mind you, as the the aroma doesn't really shout IPA (it's not really all that hoppy, just some generic pithy grapefruit that barely rises above the malt notes, and it's also slightly marred by a metallic/tinny odor). But wow, the appearance?! Big rocky heads are rare even in beers with alcohol. And a great mouth experience for an NA beer too...excellent lip-smacking sweet/bitter balance and quite a nice fluffy mouthfeel too. Such a shame they couldn't coax an assertive hoppy nose outta this one, and with more interesting hops (which seems like it would be the easiest part, right?)...this could've been near 4+ territory, which would be incredible for an NA beer!

relatively fresh can that pours clear bright gold with a large white head offering some retention and lacing. fresh golden doughy pilsner malts, noble hop freshness - minty resinous herbs; some peppery notes, super clean yeast action. moderate carbonation - could be a bit brighter; light body - oily; dry grassy-herbal finish. solid genuine pilsner.

Bottle from Growler Guys

Slightly hazy gold pour, abundant white head. Well carbonated. Nose is all about bit-of-lime Doritos. Yes, it's mosaic, but the bit-of-lime dorito thing is crazy on point. Quite dry, a bit grainy, some perfume, brett, lime peel.

Not the most spectacular table beer, but a solid example in a style I really like for the purpose.

Draught. Pours hazy orange with a medium, frothy off-white head, short retention leaving a cordon. Moderate tart and acidic citrus, white grapes, oak, light bread malt, and a dry finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation.

On tap at Champps in Brookfield - In a teku! Go Tony ... Unclear orange pour. Orange, pineapple, tropical fruit mousse with a solid dry hop presence. Super hoppy. Juicy. Pale malts. Bitter-sweet fruity finish. This is really good; hoppy, juicy, tasty. 16.6

16oz can from Discount in Waukesha with a can date of 8 weeks ago. Very clear copper amber pour with an off-orange head leaving spotty lacing. Aroma has pine, lemon, tangerine, stone fruits, honey, other tropical fruits, and solid dry hopping, with toffee. Taste brings lemon and piney hops, stone fruits, citrus, and honey, all on a solid sweet toffee backbone. Certainly hoppy, although muddled with the hop varietals, yet with that solid malt backbone. Some dry hop evidence, although not so much to completely dry this out. Almost full bodied, with some alcohol presence, the blend is fine/solid. Finishes slightly to the sweet fruity side of bittersweet. Shrug? Congrats on 10 years for one of my obviously favorite breweries. This specific one winds up quite muddled. 13.8

Taster at the Mothership. Pours black, with a small, bubbly, tan head. The aroma is chocolate syrup, mild coffee, caramelized sugar, and almond. Sweet and malty, with good balance. Smooth and enjoyable.

3.5 yrs aged. Black pour with a foamy thin tan head. Rich darkly sweet aroma with notes of brandy and plum and raisin and dates. Hints of roast malt and blackberry. Big dark boozy flavor with notes of charred barrel, dates, brandy, blackberries, and a little bittersweet dark cocoa. Lingering roasty and gently earthy finish.

12oz can from Three Cellars in the Falls. Dark brown pour with reddish tints. Aroma has sweet malts, berry, chocolate, and pastry filling. Taste is thicker than expected; sweet malts, raspberry, cream. Well blended and fairly tasty, staying away from getting too sweet. Medium bodied or a bit more. Finishes to the sweet side of bittersweet. Enjoyed this more than expected. 14.2

2018 vintage. 750 ml bottle. Pours black with moderate head. Aromas of creamy roasted malts and bourbon. Flavors follow same with additional chocolate nougat and smoky bourbon. Still a good dose of alcohol but getting better every year.
Included in a sampler flight at the brewery. Not sure this was the same Performance Review as I remember it being alot stronger abv. Decent enough but nothing spectacular.
Draught. Pours clear orange with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention with light lacing. Moderate citrus hops, medium bread malt, and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.
Included in a sampler flight at the brewery. Dark black pour. Strong notes of coffee with some alcohol burn. Somewhat on the thin side but not bad overall.

Taster at the Mothership. Pours a hazy, straw color, with a big, frothy, white head. A little lime juice, cream, lemon peel, vanilla, and a lot of floral notes. Very sweet and phenolic. Smooth, light, and silky. Delicious!
Draught. Pours clear black with a small, frothy beige head, short retention. Moderate rich coffee, light nuttiness, earthy, light hop bitterness, and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

473 ml can from the brewery. Pours a murky rhubarb colour with small pinkish head.  Aroma is tart raspberry, lemon and grains.  Flavour has tart candyish raspberry, lemon and mellow grains.  Lighter carbonation.  Decent.

Pours barely translucent light honey with a nice eggshell head. Aroma yields dank, piney hops plus zesty orange and raw malt. Flavor delivers funky piney hops, crisp raw malt, oatmeal, tangy orange,  a tropical hint. Texture provides decent body, peppy fizz, and a fruity and oat finish. Double your pleasure, double your oats.

Beer Names: Listermann Barrel Aged Imperial Nutcase - Chocolate Fluff
Reviews: 12 oz. bottle from the brewery. Pours a hazy dark brown with amber highlights and a layer of oil atop the liquid. The head quickly vanishes. Notes of peanut butter, chocolate, toasted marshmallows, fudge, vanilla, roast, oak, and bourbon. Medium-bodied, with low carbonation and a roasty, nutty, sweet, warming, slightly flat mouthfeel. A little messy and could use more carb, but the aroma is all roasted peanuts and that's fun. Somehow this one is more peanut buttery than others; I guess these particular adjuncts enhance that aspect.
Tap. Pours hazy yellow,  small white head,  decent lacing.  Aroma is pungent,  oranges,  armpits,  overripe peaches.  Flavor is light plus sweet,  light bitter.  Medium body.

Light orange appearance with mild haze and a white head. Aroma of cranberries, mild lemon zest and a light ginger spice. Similar flavor, adding moderate sweetness and light acidity. Light body with a lingering finish. OK.

Beer Names: Steel Reserve Alloy Series Spiked Tropic Storm
Reviews: Interesting light flavor, similar to watermelon or kiwi but not, not the greatest but not terrible

Draught. Pours clear gold with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention with good lacing. Heavy pine, citrus, and resin hops and hop bitterness, medium bread malt, and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Beer Names: Oskar Blues Can O' Bliss Citrus IPA
Reviews:
Poured from 12 oz. can. 

Hazy, amber gold with a medium body a 3-finger ivory head and very good lacing.  

Aroma of tangerine, tropical fruit, mandarin orange and grain. 

Taste of tangerine, mandarin orange, tropical fruit, grapefruit and sweet malt. 

Medium body and medium carbonation.
Ohh, nice Enigma.  Tap. Pours hazy yellow,  small white head,  decent lacing.  Aroma is enigma,  perfume,  fresh pine needles,  tangerine.  Flavor is light sweet,  light bitter,  juicy.  Medium body.
Tap. Pours lightly hazy golden yellow,  small white head, some lacing.  Aroma is perfume,  melon,  ginger of pine.  Flavor is light sweet, light bitter,  a bit sharp.  Medium body.  Ug

500 ml bottle via trade. Pours a deep, dark, basically opaque brown with a small tan head that settles into a ring and a thin loop of film. Notes of chocolate, vanilla, strawberries, bourbon, oak, soy, figs, and roast. Medium-bodied, with low carbonation and a flat, sweet, tangy, and warming mouthfeel. It'd be better without the strawberry and with some carbonation. It's messy.

650 ml bottle from Canada Craft Club.  Pours a dark brown colour with average-sized tan head.  Aroma is chocolate wafer, peanuts, milk and very light spice.  Flavour is peanut butter, milk chocolate and very light cinnamon.  Slick mouthfeel.  Nice but a little sweet.

Beer Names: GoodLife G. Love's Special Sauce IPA
Reviews: Draught. Pours clear golden orange with a medium, frothy white head, short retention. Heavy fruity hops, moderate hop bitterness, medium bread malt, and a dry finish. Medium-full body and medium carbonation.

Taster at the Mothership. Pours black, with a small, tan ring. The nose is big vanilla, cinnamon, mild coffee, milk chocolate, and some toasted oak. Very sweet and decadent, with a touch of bitterness. Lovely.

Draught. Pours clear dark brown with a medium, frothy beige head, medium retention. Medium roast and chocolate malt, a clean lager character, light earthy hops and hop bitterness, and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Draught. Pours clear gold with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention. Medium grainy sweet malt, light earthy and white wine hops, light hop bitterness, a clean lager character, and a dry finish. Medium-light body and medium carbonation.
Tap. Pours hazy yellow,  small white head,  decent lacing.  Aroma is floral,  tropical,  hint of armpit,  bright, strong. Flavor is light sweet,  light bitter.  Nice.  Medium body

Can from Bine & Vine. Pours clear brassy gold with a large foamy white head. Aroma of citrus, a little tropical, and mildly roasty malt support. Med plus body. Flavor is dankish citrus/pine, mildly roasty malt and notes of tropicals. Gets a bit resinish. Pretty dry. Grapefruit zest notes. Very hoppy. Strongly bitter. Excellent.

Taster at the Mothership. Pours an unclear, red color, with a small, off-white head. The aroma is raspberry, lemon cream, vanilla, and strawberry. Sweet and fruity, with a lovely, mellow tart flavor. Light and remarkably crisp and creamy. This is a fruity and delicious sour.

16 oz. Aroma is chocolate, maple syrup-covered French toast, faint wood, faint Bourbon, faint licorice. Pours a really dark brown to black with a one finger tan head with decent retention. Taste is highly sweet, never cloying, light to moderately bitter, faintly tart, with major maple flavor. Delicious.

12 oz. can purchased at Molly's Spirits in Lakeside, CO. Thanks G-unit! Pours a clear dark ruby color with a large khaki head and great retention. Good lacing. Roasted malt and coffee aroma. The flavor matches the nose, except the coffee flavor is more dominant. Mellow overall due to the added vanilla. Low carbonation. Medium+ body and semi creamy mouthfeel. Smooth.
Clear orange appearance with a beige head. Aroma of berries and light grainy notes. Similar flavor, adding moderate sweetness and minimal bitterness. Light body with a lingering fruity finish. OK.
Tap.  Pours clear pale golden,  small white head,  some lacing . Aroma is field head,  Belgian yeast,  floral,  black pepper.  Flavor is light sweet, light plus bitter. Light body.  Nice.
12 ounce can.  Pours almost black with a decent tan head.  Aroma of chocolate, coconut, and nuts.  Taste is chocolate, almonds, coconut, and roasted malt.  Nice.
12 ounce can.  Pours a mostly clear gold with a decent white head.  Aroma of malt, grain, and citrus.  Taste is malt, grain, lemon, and floral.  Pretty good.
Aroma is cherry, licorice, chocolate and little burnt wood. Taste is sweet caramel, molasses and fruit. Bitter backbone of coffee and cocoa. Softer mouthfeel.
Can. Dark brown. Bright, with just a thin head. Toasty, with a coffee aroma. Quite toasty coffee note. Medium bodied brown ale base, with again complementary toasty accents. OK.

Taster at the Mothership. Pours a pale, hazy, yellow color, with a big, frothy, white head. The aroma is lemon, butterscotch, clover honey, roses, and dust. Sweet and chalky, with a lovely, mild bitterness. Light and fluffy, and refreshing.

Can from a Lazy Dog 
Lightly hazy orange gold in color with a decent sized off white head that persists. Bready light butterscotch with pine citrus and earth. A little on the sweet side but not too shabby.

Refrigerated 12 oz. aluminum can, canned November 6, 2019 poured into a glass.  Clear golden with small/medium white head.  Aroma is light orange, medium/light body, medium carbonation, and little lacing.  Taste is orange , vanilla, some coriander, and salt.

Tap. Pours clear reddish mahogany,  small beige head,  decent lacing.  Aroma is roasty,  hint of char, coffee grounds,  toffee,  leather.  Flavor is light plus sweet,  light bitter,  beautiful roastiness. Medium body,  soft mouthfeel.  Lovely.
Cerveza oscura y amarga, con notas de café y tostado, nariz frágil de pocos aromas y leves notas de lúpulo. Desbalanceada, a pesar de su baja graduación (5%) se siente alcohólica y pesada. Regular.
On tap. Juicy tropical aroma. Delicious juicy stone fruit taste. Would get again!
355ml can. Clear copper with a foamy off-white head. Flavors are toasted cereals and barley sugar with fruity and herbal notes. Light to medium body, good carbonation, slick texture.
Tap. Pours clear golden,  small white head,  good lacing.  Aroma is light,  clean,  grain,  hint of grass,  clean.  Flavor is light sweet, light bitter.  Light body.

Beer Names: Tooth And Nail Vim and Valor
Reviews: 500ml bottle. Slightly hazy amber, effervescent bubbles and a thick foamy white head. Flavors are bread, dough, honey and spices with fruity notes. Light to medium body, lively carbonation, slick texture.

355ml can. Almost clear golden with a foamy white head. Flavors are bready cereals, pear, bubblegum and grass with spicy, woodsy and floral notes. Light to medium body, good carbonation, smooth texture.

355ml can. Cloudy orange with a thin foamy white head. Flavors are doughy cereals, mango, grapefruit, guava, grass and alcohol with spicy and piney notes. Medium body, moderate to good carbonation, smooth texture.

Beer Names: Grand River Russian Gun Imperial Stout
Reviews: 473ml can. Dark brown with a foamy beige head. Flavors are chocolate, raisins, molasses, caramel and smoke with herbal notes. Medium to full body, moderate carbonation, smooth texture.

Beer Names: Bellwoods x Modern Times An Imperial Stout with Coffee
Reviews: 473ml can. Black with a foamy brown head. Flavors are roasted cereals, molasses, coffee, resinous hops and vanilla with fruity notes. Full body, soft to moderate carbonation, silky texture.

Tap. Pours clear golden,  medium white head,  good lacing.  Aroma is grain,  grass,  light citrus,  hint of bread.  Flavor is light sweet,  light bitter,  yeasty.  Light body,  soft mouthfeel.  Interesting.

Beer Names: Steel Reserve Alloy Series Spiked Blue Razz 211
Reviews: Tastes like you would expect from a blue raspberry drink, similar to an icy but not as sweet. Fairly enjoyable
Pours cloudy yellow in color with a white head, ok drinking beer, tastes mildly like cinnamon toast crunch but nothing special, disappointed, tap at brewery.
Chocolate, cocoa powder, dark coffee aroma. Dark brown and mocha head. Definitely a dry, coffee, cocoa, cereal, light bitter hop finish, with only a slight bit of vanilla.

Draught. Pours hazy gold with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention. Medium grainy and earthy wheat malt, light lemon notes, light jasmine and a dry finish. Light body and moderate carbonation.

On tap. Pours black with no head. Aromas of roasted malts, alcohol and light coconut. Flavors of only vanilla, sour bourbon, light coconut, and sweet roasted malts. Hmmm... messy compared to the original Midnight, but that doesn’t say much...
Interesting concept beer. Not enough of the farmhouse yeastin aroma or flavor. Nice reddish pink without looking too colorful. Flavor is very real-life. Tap at brewery.
Jesus this is bad. Not sure what discriminates this from their lager, taste very similar with harsh grainy notes, corn, acetaldehyde. Light bitterness.

Beer Names: Backcountry Are You Suggesting Coconuts Migrate?
Reviews: On tap. Pours black with light head. Aromas of dry coconut, vanilla and slick roasted malts. Flavors are Bounty. Very nice coconut stout. There should be a style...
Pours dark brown, aroma and upfront taste is a brownie but way too much smoke and charcoal flavor at the end, tap at brewery.
16 oz can at Austin City Limits. Pours a pale amber with a dense white head. Tons of lacing. Big citrus fruit scents. Juicy flavors with a dry mouthfeel. Excellent IPA.
Pours an amber with thick white head and heavy lacing.  Lots of malt on the nose.  Mouthfeel is very heavy with pronounced bitterness.  Nuts, molasses and some metal taste.  Lasting bitter finish.

Can from the brewery. Pours opaque orange/gold with a frothy white head. Tastes like smooth resin, oats, booze, grapefruit hops, and biscuit malt. Medium body and low carbonation. Smells like biscuit malt, oats, resin, grapefruit hops, and faint booze.
Pours copper bronze with a big foamy head that last wells and leaves ample lacing; melon, stone fruits, citrus and fruitcake on the nose; bitter oily palate with alcohol present in the finish.

Beer Names: Dogfish Head American Beauty Hazy Ripple IPA
Reviews: Aroma has some funk. Taste also has some funk, but a lot of sweet grapefruit and oranges. Nice but slightly off for style. Can.
16oz can. Milky light orange beige with a thick sticky sandy head.  Lots of light bready cereal malts.  Some sweetness and tropical juiciness but a lot of old grass and papery flavors. Strange
Nice hops bitter flavor and palate. Hazy deep yellow. Aroma is hops with some lactose. Flavor is sweet and fruity. Tap at brewery
Pours dark black, aroma a nice mix of malts and sweet vanilla, nice malt body with a sweet vanilla-forward taste, well done, tap at brewery.

Light Niagara grape aromas and taste. Fun and different but more of a hazy ipa and less of an aged flavor. Maybe it needed to be aged longer. Great beer, but not 100% to the planned style. Tap at brewery

Bomber from The Davis Food Co-op. Pours cranberry juice color with a pink, transient head. Aroma is cider with black currant - my nose isn't picking up cranberry. Med minus body. Flavor is tart cranberry, apple skin and black currant. It's tart, but the currants add some offsetting sweetness. Decent, drinkable.

375 mL bottle. Pours clear and pale yellow. Smells of lemon, grain, lots of cardamom. Tastes of cardamom too. Grainy and light lemon lime tartness. Honey lingers in the finish. Dry and light. Well carbonated. It's good, but very light in all aspects.  It's very possible I would really dig this in a different setting, but it's not doing it for me here.

Finally getting around to this a couple months late. Pours near black with frothy brown foam that settles to a thin cap, moderate lacing. Aromas are simpler than expected, mostly sweet malt, mild ginger snap and a touch of coffee. Flavors bring a vanilla sweetness to the forefront, combining with the roast character, and not much in the way of ginger snap. Very pleasant and easy drinking smoothness. Medium-light mouthfeel and a fairly clean finish. Will try again next year for sure!

On tap at Das Beer Garden. Black and a little transparent at the edges. Smells of bourbon, oak, earthy coffee. Tastes of bourbon, sweet chocolate, coffee, oak. Vanilla and sugar lingers. Big, boozy, heavy, and sweet. But it's very flavorful. I don't often enjoy beers like this, but this is excellent.

Clear light golden appearance with a small white head. Mild aroma of zesty hops, toasted grain and a light herbal spice. Similar flavor, adding mild to moderate bitterness and light sweetness. Light body with a slight watery finish. OK.

Beer Names: Hill Farmstead Leaves of Grass: Dubbel
Reviews: 375 mL bottle. Pours deep amber with a khaki head. Smells of red wine, slight bready malts, oak, some fruity yeast. Tastes tart up front. Gives way to some brown bread with dark fruit yeast flavors. Then red wine sourness kicks back in with an oaky finish. I didn't know if this was going to be sour, but I thought it might. I'm not sure I'm happy that it is, though. I kinda wanted to see if they could make a nice dubbel. It's pleasant, but not what I really wanted from it.

Beer Names: Wild Leap Vacanza Coconut Cream Pie
Reviews: From a can. Pours a cloudy copper with an off white head.  Aromas are of pineapple and coconut. Flavors are tart and fruity.

12 oz. bottle.  Pours black with a khaki head.  Smells of aggressive grassy hops and strong roasted malt.  Tastes of roasted malt, chocolate, coffee bitterness immediately, slight malty sweetness, and some grassy and spicy hop bitterness.  Medium body and remarkably drinkable.  This is wonderful.

The body is a clear, dark caramel color. No head. Aroma is strong caramel and salt, and some dark stone fruits. Taste is fairly salty and tart, a touch of fruit sweetness at the end. Texture is crisp and fizzy.

Tap. Pours clear black,  small beige head,  decent lacing.  Aroma is light,  roasty,  mocha,  ash, more roast. Flavor is light plus sweet,  lighter bitter,  roasty.  Medium body,  soft mouthfeel,  low carbonation.

Beer Names: Foreign Objects From Stardust to Thoughtform
Reviews: (Can) Cloudy, pale yellow body with a medium off-white head. Aroma of pineapple, orange, grapefruit, peach; slightly herbal. Medium body, soft carbonation. Fruity flavor, dusty; long herbal aftertaste.

Draught. Pours clear orange with a medium, frothy off-white head, long retention with good lacing. Moderate fruity and pine hops, moderate hop bitterness, medium bread and dough malt, light alcohol, and a dry finish. Medium-full body and medium carbonation.

Beer Names: Creemore Springs Mad & Noisy Coconut Porter
Reviews: 2020/02/05 - Pours bear black with a foamy, light tan head that quickly reduces and leaves minimal lacing. Aroma is toasted malt, cereal grain, coffee, hints of caramel and semisweet chocolate. Taste is more toasty cereal malts, semisweet chocolate and coffee. No real coconut to speak of. Mouthfeel is medium and slick with smooth carbonation and a toasty, grainy finish. Ok.

Draught. Pours clear black with a large, creamy tan head, long retention with excellent lacing. Moderate rich roast and coffee malt, medium pine and resin hops, moderate hop bitterness, and a dry finish. Medium-full body and moderate carbonation.

Tap. Pours clear hazel,  small beige head,  decent lacing.  Aroma is roast,  nutty,  dark toast,  a hint of wood,  earth.  Flavor is light plus sweet,  minimal bitterness,  nice roasty notes.  Medium body,  smooth. Good.
Draft at BJ's in Huntsville. Pale Gold color with a nice white head and solid lacing. Hoppy aroma with a pepper spiciness.

Tap. Pours hazy golden orange,  small off white head,  some lacing.  Aroma is light,  armpit,  coconut,  odd. Flavor is light plus sweet,  very light bitter,  green coconut.  Light plus body,  low carbonation.  Ug
Tap. Pours clear golden,  small white head,  good lacing.  Aroma is grain,  citrus,  a bit floral.  Flavor is light sweet,  light plus bitter.  Light body.
I smell fresh grains, lemon, yeast & fresh lumber. clear brown-green tinged yellow. still a little bready flavor, but strong citrus-lemony wiht grapefruit peel. a little hin on the palate

Draught. Pours clear gold with a medium, frothy white head, long retention with excellent lacing. Heavy pine and resin hops, grapefruit hops, moderate hop bitterness, medium white cracker malt, and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Beer Names: Cascade Lakes Crimson Dawn Red Ale
Reviews: Draught. Pours clear amber with a large, frothy off-white head, long retention with excellent lacing. Moderate pine and resin hops and hop bitterness, medium bread malt, and a dry finish. Medium-full body and medium carbonation.

Beer Names: August Schell Shift Happens No. 1 DDH Lager
Reviews: 16 oz can pours an almost clear deep golden color with lasting off-white head that leaves some lacing.  Aroma has pine, apricot, lemon, citrus hops, and sugar.  Taste is sweet, despite the hoppiness.  Body is medium to full with perfect carbonation and a creamy mouthfeel.  I was surprised to see Schell's try something like this and sold in 16 oz. four-packs.  The can says "A transitional miniseries in four parts", so I hope to find the subsequent episodes.

Black pour with a fizzy tan head and spots of lacing .... aroma of cocoa, molasses, dark roasted malts, toffee and dark fruits among with caramel malts .... taste is of toffee, roasted malts, dark fruits, cocoa, molasses and caramel malts with licorice .... some leather .... little bitter on the back end and sweet .... finish has licorice, cocoa and toffee .... solid beer for the style, good balance, thick, oily and a great sipper

Draught. Pours clear dark brown with black hues and a medium, frothy off-white head, short retention with light lacing. Medium roast and chocolate malt, medium earthy and floral hops, medium hop bitterness, and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.
16 oz can in 4 pack. Dark golden color - cloudy. Hoppy, pine-like aroma.  This is a good one. Very hoppy, moderately good flavored hops.

Draft at Bru Craft. Opaque black pour with a low dense light brown head. Coffee. Dark cocoa. Cinnamon. Ginger. Vanilla. Nutmeg. Hazelnut. Molasses. Burnt marshmallow. Soft nose when cold. Broadens as it warms. A nice Christmasy version of the original.

Beer Names: Evil Twin I Always Felt Closer to IPAs Than I Did to People (9%)
Reviews: Hazy golden color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of slight sweet malt, floral/pine hops, tropical fruit, some grass, & citrus; Flavor of malt, some yeast, caramel, pine hops, tropical fruit, and juicy citrus; Finish is dry & fairly bitter; Nicely balanced; Really nice.

Aus der Flasche (bbe 23.06.2020) im 2020-02 getrunken. Dieses Stout besitzt eine deutlische Kaffeenote und Aromen von einem MARS-Riegel. Überraschend ist das doch volle Aroma bei diesem niedrigen Alkoholgehalt.

Rich dark brown/black color; Medium to heavy slightly creamy body; Aroma of toasted/charred sweet malt, vanilla, dark chocolate, coffee, dark fruit, & anise/licorice; Flavor of roasted sweet malt, caramel/vanilla, dark chocolate, espresso/coffee, black licorice, and bourbon; Warm finish; Nicely balanced; Pretty intense overall - good.

Rich black color; Medium to heavy creamy body; Aroma of toasted sweet malt, cinnamon, pumpkin, & nutmeg/spice; Flavor of roasted sweet malt, caramel, pumpkin, molasses, cinnamon, nutmeg, and some vanilla; Warm finish; Nicely balanced; Not one over the top - very nice.

Beer Names: Jack's Abby Framinghammer - Barrel Aged Coffee
Reviews: Dark brown/black color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of toasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate, toffee/caramel, & some bourbon notes; Flavor of roasted sweet malt, caramel/toffee, dark chocolate, coffee, some dark fruit, and licorice; Warm finish; Nicely balanced; Nice sipper - enjoyable.

Beer Names: Cascade Lakes Pure Dead Brilliant Maple Scotch Ale
Reviews: Draught. Pours clear dark brown with a medium, creamy beige head, medium retention with good lacing. Moderate rich caramel and toasted bread malt, light nuttiness, light alcohol and earthiness, and a sweet finish. Full body and light carbonation with medium alcohol warmth.

Nice dark brown/black color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of toasted malt, rich dark chocolate, cocoa, & some coffee; Flavor of roasted/smoked malt, dark chocolate, coffee/espresso, hops, and some caramel; Finish is slightly bitter; Nicely balanced; Very good.
Draft pour. The beer is a clear gold with a white head of foam. Sweet, grassy, and a bit earthy. Dry, finish. A little spicy. Lighter body and medium carbonation.
Bottle from Ambleside Wines, Ambleside.  Golden with a head.  It has a decent pale ale aroma, but fails to follow through in taste with just a bland hoppiness available.

[Draught at Tapworks Pub] Pours a murky yellow-gold with an average size lasting frothy white head. Nice hoppy aroma, citrusy, piney and herbal, along with tropical fruit and sweet bready malt in the background. Nice flavour as well, follows the aroma, along with an average bitter finish. Medium bodied. This surprised me with how good it is.
Cask @ Fox & Goose, Hebden Bridge.  Golden with a small head. It has an ordinary hoppy nose but is full of cucumber in its taste that lingers.  The style of the ale is redundant for it.

Pours a deep, dark brown with a finger of tan foam that settles to a ring, no lacing. Aromas of roast malt and a slight sweetness. Flavors are more abundant with a nice sweet toffee dominating among biscuit and mild nut presence. This is how I like brown ales - with low hop bitterness and focus on the malt. Well done!

Aus der Flasche im 2020-02 getrunken. Diese kupferne Ale ist typisch im Englischen Stil und hat neben einer Karamellnote eine feine Hopfennote. EIn Ale was einfach Spaß im Glas macht ohne zu kompliziert zu werden.

Beer Names: Woodland Empire Running on the Spot
Reviews: On Tap at the Boise brewery/taproom  Crystal clear deep golden with a touch of orange.  Thin wispy off white skin od micro bubbles. Faint very light pale malts in the aroma.  big grassy floral hop character. Feels pretty light for 7%  Well attenuated.  LIght clean finish.

Hazy deep yellow with small white head.  Aroma hay, citrus and tropical fruit.  Medium body.  Mildly bitter, some sweet juice but more on the grassy than fruit bomb side.  Found this one with a bit more intensity of flavor than their other offerings.
Can into tulip. Nice straw color with some haze. Pineapple and pine notes. Mild bitterness. Decent.

Copenhagen 26/12 2018. 35,5 cl bottle from Voldby Købmandsgård Webshop. This is the 2016 release with an ABV of 11,9. The Classic label with the tagline “Is good for everything a flavoured stout ought to be good for”.

Pours opaque dark brown with small beige head. Settles as thin, transparent layer of foam unable to cover the surface of the beer. 

Aroma is very intensive, sweet with a nice boozy backbone. Sweet chocolate and caramel. Like coming into a candystore offer9ng Classic chocolates. Shoe cream, vanilla, coffee. Powerful alcohol lurking in the background. 

Low carbonation. Thick, oily and creamy texture. Have to work a bit to get it out of the glass. 

Flavor is heavy sweet. Followed by more moderate bitterness. Aftertaste is long and sweet with a spicy undercurrent. Lingers for a long sweet while. 

This is a very nice, very sweet and very strong Imperial Stout. A metal in it-selskab - but I would not dare to drink it for Breakfast.

Beer Names: Lost And Grounded / Cloudwater / Burning Sky The Parrot Lounge
Reviews: Can from Londis, Knighton, Leicester. Dark brown, practically black. A tiny uneven layer of light brown head. The aroma is quite delicate and complex, with notes of liquorice, molasses, cough syrup. Bittersweet, chalky taste with more liquorice and some stone fruit. Medicinal bitterness in the finish. Soft carbonation. Very well put together.
Yellow-orange, small white head.  Aroma is straightforward hops and malt, medium light body.  Flavor is mildly bitter, some malt balance, some citrus and pine, generic and acceptable.
Had poured from bomber-size bottle. Sparkling amber-gold with a fizzy white head.  Smells of fruit - plum/peach. Taste is sweet, mildly bitter - fruity nuance a little boozy, a bit tart but not sour.

On tap at Ellyn's Tap & Grill in Glen Ellyn, IL. served to a tulip showing a cloudy, orangey/gold color, a fluffy layer of soft white froth that slowly reduced to a ring, with foamy spots of lacing. The nose was soft grain, citrus as orange & lemon/lime, a bit of pit fruit, tartness & tanginess, and some agave sweetness. Medium bodied, with decent spritz to the effervescence, the taste was similar, with amped tartness & tanginess, a bit of earthy astringency, and light salinity to the finish. Very palate appealing. Like it when the flavor equals or outshines the aroma.

Copenhagen 14/10-2015. 50 cl from draft at Søernes Ølbar. 

Pours dark brown - almost black with small light beige head. 

Aroma is of chocolate and coffee. 

Soft carbonation and creamy palate. 

Taste is very well balanced between sweetness which is not too sugary and rich coffee bitterness. You can sense the quite prominent intensity from the alcohol. 

A very nice imperial stout you are forced to enjoy at a thoughtful pace.
Cloudy orange yellow.  Grassy hop aroma.  Medium body.  Alcohol well hidden.  Mildly bitter, touch of citrus and herbal hops.  It's fine.  Unmemorable.

Hazy yellow, small white head.  Aroma on the malty side.  Medium light body.  Some up front bitterness then gets a bit sweet but without the hop intensity to balance, but finishes a little better on the dry side.  Decent, style not really as advertised.

Beer Names: Stone Viking Space Probe Double IPA
Reviews: Had on tap at Tenaya Creek, this was delicious. Quite hazy, a ton of grapefruit flavors with a little orange.  This is the Stone quality I remember but had been missing in some recent average beers. This one is top notch! Tasty tasty.

Beer Names: Skyline Beer Wise Guide Brown Ale
Reviews: Dark brown with small tan head.  Aroma roasted and sweet malt.  Medium light body.  Flavor is off dry, lightly sweet malt with toasty finish.  Solid.

Beer Names: Coronado / Pizza Port South Of The Pier
Reviews: This was a pretty run of the mill.  Not a ton of bittering hops, okay flavor.  Nothing special or memorable.

Poured a hazy, light yellow colour with a bright white, creamy head. Minimal lacing. Light bouquet on the nose. With scents of cereal and light hops. First swig was really quite thin with watery flavours of very light hops, honey and a little nuts. Finish is quite plain with minimal lingering flavours.

Acquired a can in a trade with tfontana, thanks Tom! Can date of 1-23-20. Aroma shows apricot, peach, house yeast. Surprised at the lasting grassy note through the melon and fruit. Texture has a massively juicy center that turns dry. Alcohol is not here. Well above average!
Cherries and lime and not too sour.  Perhaps the extra alcohol helps, because I found this more drinkable than most in this style.

An American Lager with no bitter aftertaste. Clean but not overpowering Lemon and Ginger flavor. A Light & Crisp finish. Doesn't weigh you down. Perfect for a warm afternoon or just relaxing at home or with your friends. High Recommended if you are an America Lager Fan.
Pours clear yellow with average head. Medium body with average carbonation. Taste of fruit with dry finish. Well balanced hops. Has a bit strange after taste.

Beer Names: Crooked Stave Nightmare On Brett (Aged on Leopold Bros Whiskey Barrels)
Reviews:
Glass, 2-ounce, draught, A blackout brunch 'til Monday lunch at Lupulus, savoured on March 3, 2019; eye: dark brown, opaque, no effervescence, beige head, light lacing; nose: acidity, light roast, light fruity, light cherry; mouth: acidity, light roast, light fruit, light cherry, berry pungency, finale in berry pungency with presence of acidity, medium body, average carbonation, slick texture; overall: correct
 

FRANÇAIS

Verre, 2 onces, en fût, A blackout brunch ‘til Monday lunch chez Lupulus, savourée le 3 mars 2019; œil : brun foncé, opaque, pas d’effervescence, mousse beige, légère dentelle; nez : acidité, léger torréfaction, léger fruité, léger cerise; bouche : acidité, léger torréfaction, léger fruité, léger cerise, âcreté de petits fruits, finale en âcreté de petits fruits avec présence d’acidité, corps moyen, carbonatation moyenne, texture coulante; en résumé : correct
Pours pale yellow with average white head that leaves lacing behind. Aroma of citrus and taste of what with low dry hoppy finish. Nice.
