The finish is oaky and very tart with a lingering red wine and sour fruit aftertaste. Pretty good all around.

[email protected] Copenhagen (23/01/2020) - hazed yellow with a white head. Tropical fruity medley going on, some lemon, grapefruit, some pineapple, soft sweet malts, medium to light body, hoppy finish.
[email protected] Copenhagen (23/01/2020) - hazy golden orange with a white head. Light tart fruity with notes of peach, grapefruit. some stone fruit, light malty, yeasty note, tart fruity finish.

Beer Names: Wylam / Naparbier Empathy For the Devil
Reviews: [email protected] Copenhagen (23/01/2020) - golden hazed pour with a white head. Juicy fruity with a plethora of tropical fruit offered, waves of papaya, mango and grapefruit, pine needles, soft malty backing, medium body, touch of citrus rind bitterness into the hoppy close. Great stuff.

Sample at the taproom during the "Streetside 3 Year Anniversary Bash!" on 09/28/2019. Slightly hazy amber-orange color with a medium thin white head that recedes steadily to an outer ring. Stringy lace. Fruity and oaky aroma with wine and malt notes. Medium body with an oaky white wine character and notes of funky yeast, tart citrus and bready malt. The finish is oaky and tart with a wine grape aftertaste. Pretty good all around.

440ml can. Cloudy, bright, light red colour with average to huge, diminishing, minimally pink-ish, off-white head. Sweet-ish, fruity, raspberry dominated aroma, some cherry, some fruit acid, slight sherbet character overall. Taste is mildly tart, minimally sweet fruity, slightly lactic, diluted hints of cherry and raspberry with a minimally leafy touch, cautious hints of mild sauerkraut. Well balanced, refreshing, nice.
Honey pecan nose. Clear amber, medium head. Pecan. Medoum body, moderate carbonation.

4/2/2020. Bottle sample courtesy of danlo, cheers Ed! Pours hazy golden orange with a small bubbly white head. Aroma of funky apples, light brown sugar, caramel and a hint of spice. Moderate sweetness and light to moderate tartness. Moderate body, slight oily texture, above average carbonation. Dry, tangy tart finish. Nice.

Sample at the taproom during the "Streetside 3 Year Anniversary Bash!" on 09/28/2019. Slightly hazy reddish-orange color with a medium thin white head that dissipates quickly to a wispy film. Short strings of lace. Aroma of herbal yeast, fruit, tea and malt. Medium body with flavors of mildly funky yeast, sweet-tart melon, green tea, vinous oak and doughy malt. The finish is oaky, funky and tart with a fruity yeast aftertaste. Good beer all around.

Bottle from Beermoth, Manchester.  Extremely dark and certainly strong tasting, this slow sipper does have a velvet smoothness to its roasted malts that's very pleasant once you get used to the alcohol content in this one.  Sat in my cellar for over 6 years but absolutely fine when opened.
Watery, not much flavour, but nice bitterness and nice after taste. Nice dark brown colour, wait actually quite red.
Very decent and notably smooth double IPA, avoiding much of the hop burn. On tap at the source.
can. pale golden. pale lagery malty nose, light green herby citrus. med light bodied, good bitters, citrussy slight zingy finish. a clean crisp thing. lawnmover-like beer.

Beer Names: Town Fruit Dart - Blackberry, Lemon & Vanilla
Reviews: Lightly tart, quaffable stuff and smooth outside of its base.  Good fruit overall.

Beer Names: North Brewing Co Big House Waltz
Reviews: Can sourced from Kihoskh - totally opaque orange colour with a medium creamy white head. Bold intense juicy fruity with some papaya and mango, lychee, substantial mouthfeel and medium plus body, pine needles and light bitter tingling hop spice, robust dank hoppy close. Gorgeous stuff.
Labelled as an IPA and hoppy, without hop burn.  Understated, today's American pale really.  Good and smooth.

Beer Names: North Brewing Co The Leafcutter DDH IPA
Reviews: Can sourced from Kihoskh - hazy golden yellow with a white head. Juicy fruity with some tasty notes of mango, pineapple, grapefruit, smooth creamy substantial mouthfeel and medium body, light rindy citrus bitterness into the lingering hoppy finish. Beautiful.
Malt job, hits the style but would like a touch of spice to make it interesting.  At the source.
Very roasty and watered down stout, on tap at the source.  Not so quaffable.

Beer Names: Brew By Numbers 42/06 DDH Pale Ale - Number Six
Reviews: Can at home in Hackney - picked up from the Bermondsey taproom. Pours lightly hazy gold with a modest, foamy white head. Great stuff overall, definitely one of the better BBNo hoppy beers I have had recently. Has light sweetness, pleasant pithy citrus, only a whisper of minerality, some melon, tangerine, mild rindy bitterness, background pale malts. Light to medium bodied with fine carbonation. Nicely balanced finish, with a hint of cat pee, tropical accents, more pithy citrus. Really sound.

Draft at Lovejoy Wharf. Pours hazy red/brown with a fizzy beige head. Tastes like butter toffee, raisin, molasses, and earthy malt. Medium body and low carbonation. Smells like raisin, earthy malt, toffee, and molasses.

Beer Names: Anchor Brewers' Pale Ale - Galaxy Hop Blend
Reviews: 34.5cl fles. Troebel heel van kleur, fijne romige witte schuimkraag. De geur is muf en citrus. Smaak is zoet, mout, citrus en licht perzik. Medium body en veel koolzuur.

Draft at Lovejoy Wharf. Pours hazy gold with a frothy white head. Tastes like resin, leather, pine hops, grassy malt, and grapefruit. Light/medium body and low carbonation. Smells like resin, leather, pine hops, grassy malt, and grapefruit.
Draft at Lovejoy Wharf. Pours cola  brown with a creamy beige head. Tastes like raisin cinnamon, and earthy malt. Light body and low carbonation. Smells like earth, cinnamon, and raisin.
Can from Tesco. A slightly hazy orange, with a thin head. A nice mix of fruit with a touch of spice. Not one for quaffing at 5.6%, but it's alright, good for the price.
black beer with a decent brown head. Roasted Malt, coffee, caramel, raisins and liquorice. Not too heavy in Alcohol and nicely balanced.

Beer Names: Brew By Numbers 21/05 Pale Ale - Citra
Reviews: Canned, 440 ml shared with Simon, Max and Miro B. Hazy yellow, medium white head. Fruity, dank, some tropical fruit, citrus, smooth. Medium bodied.

Beer Names: North Brewing Co Ute West Yorkshire IPA
Reviews:
27/IX/19 - on tap @ Borefts Day 1, BB: n/a - (2019-1560) Thanks to the international RateBeer Crew for sharing today's beers!

Little cloudy blond to beige beer, creamy white head, little stable, somewhat adhesive. Aroma: super fruity, lots of tropical fruits, oranges, very nice! MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: bitter, malty, grains, hay, tropical fruits, citrus, grapefruit, nice bitterness. Aftertaste: very bitter, grapefruit, lovely!

Orange hazy with a two centimetre thick head.
Smell of mango, passion fruit and grapefruit with a grainy note. Full bodied IPA with a pleasant bitterness and dominant fruit notes, with a little gingerbread something.
A very tasty and drinkable IPA.

very clear, light-yellow colour
white foam that dissolves quickly and leaves little residue
smells of hay, flowers—rose?
tastes surprisingly like blossom honey—sweet, malty, floral notes
oily mouthfeel, no distinct carbonation, lingers relatively shortly
great beer if you’ve got a sweet tooth

Got this scary can from JRs. Was not looking forward to this tick. After all, it says it has some artificial flavors in it. Pours clear pale from a pounder can.  Smell is somewhat artificial apple, like hardtack candy. Taste is as expected, somewhat rude ass artificial apple candy with a vanilla backbone. Cannot get this. It also has a warming sensation as it goes down the gullet. Can't say I'm disjointed because I didn't expect much. I had high hopes for the Blockhouse brand but I'm afraid they are just turning into another alky laced soda pop brand. This stuff is more on the line of those kindah malt beverages, has little to do with beer, thanks. I'm going to mix the rest of this with a can of IC light to try to straighten it out a bit and make it more acceptable. Whew.

Draft at Lovejoy Wharf. Pours hazy gold with a fizzy white head. Tastes like guava, pear, booze, resin, and pineapple. Light/medium body and low carbonation. Smells like booze, resin, pineapple, and pear.

Beer Names: Brew By Numbers 55 Double IPA - Mosaic Citra
Reviews: Canned, 440 ml, shared with Simon, Max and Miro B. Hazy yellow, white head. Tropical fruit, bit dank, quite dry, smooth. Medium bodied.

Beer Names: Wild Weather / New Lion War Against Reality
Reviews:
Rocky white head stayed on a murky dark amber coloured still body.
Pineapple, Tropical fruits, mango & confectionery aroma.
Medium bodied, pleasantly carbonated on the front with soft smooth back.
Tropical fruits, mango, kiwi, hoppy, garlic & nectarine tastes.

Beer Names: The Kernel Foeder Beer Nelson Sauvin
Reviews: Bottle at home in Hackney - picked up at the brewery. Pours mostly clear gold with a frothy, pure white head. Incredible beer, with a gorgeous mix of pissy southern hemisphere hop and farmyard funk. Lightly sweet, only a little bitterness, perhaps a touch of pine and lemon rind. Light bodied with delicate, massaging carbonation. Balanced finish with a hint of acidity, further cat pee, dry brett funk, melon, mild citrus. Exceptional.
Draft at Lovejoy Wharf. Tastes like light funk, citrus, hay and dry peach. Light body and low/medium carbonation. Smells like funk, hay, peach, and leather.

Beer Names: North Coast Old Rasputin Russian Imperial Stout
Reviews: Almost black with low head. Aroma with coffee and chocolate. Some dried fruit in the taste, together with chocolate. Stored several years in the cellar and still fresh taste.

Beer Names: Central Waters Brewer's Reserve Belgian Style Quadruple Ale
Reviews: Proefglas van 35,5cl-fles. U; Troebel amber-bruin met een rode gloed e neen dunne cremekleurige schuimkraag. G: Bourbon, hout, ietwat vanille, gedroogd fruit en kandijsuiker. S: Zoet. Karamel, gedroogd fruit, beetje vanille en bourbon. Alcoholwarmte. M: Volmondig met een lichte carbonatie.

Proefglas van 47,3cl-blik. U: Modderig blond met een witte schuimkraag. G: "Dank", ananas, citrus, "zweterig" en wat hars. S: Zoet met wat hopbitterheid. Fruit punch met o.a. ananas en lychee, citrus, "dank", den en een hint van zeep. Droge afdronk. M: Smooth met medium carbonatie.

Draft at Lovejoy Wharf. Pours clear gold with a creamy white head. Tastes like chardonnay, smooth lemon, grassy malt, white grape, and funk. Light body and low carbonation. Smells like chardonnay, grassy malt, white grape, yeast, and funk.

Beer Names: Night Shift  / Vanished Valley Cobbled Together
Reviews: Draft at Lovejoy Wharf. Tastes like peach, tart citrus, cracker malt, and vanilla. Light body and low carbonation. Smells like peach, citrus, cracker malt, and vanilla.

Beer Names: Tampa Bay Old Elephant Foot IPA
Reviews: Brukar ju inte betygsätta Ipa på ratebeer men denna lite speciell . Ok nu kommer omdömet . Läs nu . Fat på Kapitelhuset Växjö. Doftar cederträ och ek samt nybakat bröd från Bröd och Sovel . Skakar maltigt och blommigt som fan. Udda smakrik Ipa . Blommig parfymig och tydlig efterbeska . Spännande Ipa
Old school Sierra bitter hip juice. On tap at p house. Hazy orange golden with small to medium head. Nice lace. Grapefruit, pine, and orange rind. Nice
Can. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are nice bitter hops, fruits, flowers, malt and has a nice long bitter finish.

Barwa pomarańczowa, piwo mętne, piana biała, zbita, zdobiąca szkło.
Aromat średnio-intensywny, cytrusowy, w tyle słodkie pomarańcze.
W smaku mega soczyste, gładkie, lekko słodkie. Dużo pomarańczy - słodki sok, gorzka skórka pomarańczy. Goryczka srednio-wysoka, grejpfrutowa, lekko pylasta. Alkohol niewyczuwalny.

Farbe: schwarz. Pechschwarz. OK, im Strahl dunkelbraun.
Schaum: dicht beständig, hellbraun 
Nase: säuerlich, nicht viel. Möh. Bisschen Cola. Bei leererem Glas kommt auch karamrll, Asche und Holz raus.
Geschmack: relativ sauer, feinsprudlig, dann ordentlich bitter, dann aber auch rund, hat wohl ordentlich Malz und Hopfen drin.abgang dann gerösteter Malz, im Nachgeschmack kommt die säuerliche Asche dazu. Äh das meinen die auf der Flasche mit Kaffee und Bitterschokolade. Komplex aber nicht ganz meins.

Butelka. Ładny ,złoty,klarowny kolor. Piana średnia,biała,opadła szybko. W aromacie słodki mix tropików, wyraźne nuty żywicy. W smaku początkowo słodko,karmel,syrop,mix owoców,lekkie słodkie cytrusy,później wyraźną goryczka,żywiczna ,zalegająca. Wysycenie raczej małe,lekko oleista tekstura.
Aroma is bready malts, slight citrus and very basic Pilsner all around. The flavor is bready malts, mild fruit/citrus and a smooth/medium grainy finish.
Aroma is fresh strawberries. Tart strawberry notes shine through in the flavor as well, along with a bit of tannins and some funk. Pretty good.

Beer Names: Flash House Dark Chocolate & Mint Porter
Reviews: På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Svart. Filmskum. Aroma av After Eight. Smaken bare mint. Uvariert. Lett tørr avslutning

Słomkowe. Lekko zamglone. Piana spora, szamponowa. 
W aromacie chmiele amerykańskie zdominowane przez kolendrę. Trochę żelaza – to od chmielu. 
Zbożowo i wodniście. Dopiero w posmaku czuć trochę goryczki. 
Piwo jest bardzo lekkie.  Słodkawe. Nawet nie bardzo brzeczkowe. 
Jako bezalko nawet nawet.
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Gråbrun. Uklar. Filmskum. Klementinaroma. Smaken søte plommer. Tørr syrlig ettersmak.
Piwo złote, zmętnione. Piana niska, szybko opada. W aromacie cytrusy. W smaku delikatna grapefruitowa goryczka. Pełnia niska. Wysycenie średnie.

Beer Names: By The Horns / Flavourly Fresh Tracks Lager
Reviews: Keg at By the Horns Brewery, Summerstown.  Clear mid golden.  Quite a crisp lager, but with a pretty decent flavour.

500ml bottle via Appleyards, Shrewsbury. Clear gold appearance. Foamy white head. Moderately sweet malt on the nose. Taste presents a moderately sweet, crisp, bright fruity hops. A proper real ale named after a steam locamotive with picture of said train on the bottle. I believe I've actually travelled on this at the Severn valley railway too. Excellent sweet blonde real ale.
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Mørk gylden. Uklar. Filmskum. Sitrusaroma. Smaken tørr. Papir & mango. Litt bitter avslutning.

330ml glass bottle from Seven Seasons, Hoxton. Served at cellar temperature into a stout glass. Dated as bottled on 17/05/19. 

The beer pours a perfect black colour developing a one and a half finger mocha colour head. Uniform with medium sized bubbles. The head settles to a thick layer before finally disappearing half way through the drink. A lovely lacing. Visually this one looks like a top beer. 

The aroma has an identical profile to tiramisu. Heavy dark roasted coffee. Vanilla. Woody. Muscovado. Figs. Coffee, and the woody smell of the barrel ageing are the dominant notes. Nasally stunning. 

The taste is where the beer deviates away from great, in my opinion. Too alcoholic. I do understand the beer is 11.5% and imperial in style, but on the tastebuds the alcohol dominates and little else is present. I feel as the only reason I can taste coffee, vanilla or oak is because of the strength of aroma leading to perception. The beer is moderately sweet. 

The beer feels thick in the mouth, a lot of alcohol warmth, also in the pit of the stomach. A slightly dry, moderately sweet feel. 

Maybe just too much for my palate. A great beer for look and aroma but too heavily dominated by booze on the taste. 

One I’d put in the same category as Samuel Smiths Chocolate Stout. I think it would be good in a very small amount. But even on a slow slow drink 330 feels far too much. A sharer.

500 ml bottle from Tavour, 2/4/20.  2019 Reserve, Bottled 3/18/19.  Pours a darker, rusty orange color with a thick, foamy and frothy, beige head.  Strongly funky / peppery, some wood, herbal, pear, and grape notes.  Bright, tingly, and fairly tart.  A nice complexity has been developed at this point.  I could see it changing with more age, but as it is right now, it is drinking nicely.  Nicely blended.  
7/4/8/4/16
# 1814; 2/2020. Rice and grains in aroma. Gold, clear body. Light body, worty, grainy, herbal, very sweet. Bad lager. 0,3 l bottle from asian food shop, Prague. Somewhere in EU produced beer.
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Gylden. Filmskum. Plommearoma. Smaken plommer & rips. Tørr bæraktig avslutning.
Bottle. Zlatá farba, biela pena, výrazný sediment. Vôňa sladová, chlebová, mierne citrus, chmeľ. Chuť sladová, citrusová. Mierna horká dochuť.

Beer Names: Brick (UK) / Dogma Druže Cherry & Fig Schwarzbier
Reviews: Canned, 330 ml, shared with Max. Brown, small beige head. Caramel, some figs, watery, vague cherries. Sweetish. Thin finish. A mess really.
Beer with copper color, fuzzy aspect, soft bitterness, soft carbonized, some of foam on top, (shared a 50cl bottle beer with PG, bought at "NORMA", Großmehring, DE #1095)(#155 DE)(#73 Bavaria).
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Svart. Mokkafarget skumring. Lakrisaroma. Smaken røyk&sjokolade. Tørr avslutning.

Beer Names: Brew By Numbers 75 Sour IPA - Amarillo, Columbus, Simcoe
Reviews: Canned, 440 ml, courtesy of Miro. Shared with him and Max. Hazy yellow, no head. Sour, citric, low carbonation. Some bitterness in finish. Medium bodied.
Smell of hops, spruce. Clear amber colour, high off-white head. Aroma of hops, spruce, a faint of honey. Regular IIPA with pure flavours. Bitter. Medium carbon, slightly oily texture.

Beer Names: Gipsy Hill / Ignition Brewing Social Brew Collective
Reviews:
2 finger white head. Weak lacing.
Very hazy, mid yellow to light orange coloured beer.

Aroma of clementine, creamy mango, overripe pineapple, passionfruit and sweet white bread.

Taste of pink grapefruit, orange peels, clementine, tree resin, unripe passionfruit and lightly phenolic.

Mouthfeel is semi-dense but with light edges that makes it very drinkable. Medium bitterness. Medium carbonation.  A bit fizzy. Lightly astringent. Watery finish.

Poured dark mahogany body with tan cream lace top. A definite coffee malt aroma. Taste is medium sweet (milk chocolate) to bitter (coffee grounds). A little background fruit. Palate is medium bodied creamy texture soft to average carbonation and a bitter finish. Delivers a mocha stout.
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Amber. Litt uklar. Skumring. Aroma av søt frukt. Smaken jordbærsyltetøy. Lett tørr avslutning.

Tap at Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Brussels, 4th February 2020.  Shit the bed this is a good one.  Pours black with a red hue, aroma is vineous, almost barrel, roasted notes.  Taste is smooth, vinous, tart, roasted notes, young grapes, it’s a perfect blend and very unusual, light and easy to drink, probably dangerous :)

Clear golden with a thin head.
Strawy smell with a strong corn note. Not much going on at the attack, later a malty taste with a little acidity and bitterness develops. But in general this beer is weak bodied and bland. Low carbonation.
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Mørk gylden. Luftig filmskum. Plommearoma. Smaken svisker & plommer. Litt tynn. Tørr, papiraktig avslutning.
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Svart. Luftig skumring. Krydret sjokoladearoma. Smaken kanel. Tørr avslutning.

Belle bière noire avec une mousse beige à très fines bulles bien engageante. Nez : malts, fruits noirs, caramel, porto. Bouche vive, crémeuse, ronde et onctueuse avec candi, pruneau, mélasse, chocolat, épices, petite acidité. Carbonatation moyenne et finale un peu sirupeuse, amère et épicée. Je lui mettrais bien 5 Pistoles à cette quadruple dégustée dans mon verre de chez "La Trappe" !!
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Gylden. Skumring. Blomsteraroma. Smaken overmoden bær. Tørr avslutning.
Bouteille de 500 ml. Arômes de fruits exotiques et de houblon. Goût d'orange, d'ananas, de mangue, de citron et de houblon floral. Très bonne NEIPA.
Brew York Tonkoko 4.3%. Blackish ruby, dark chocolate malt and coconut aroma, full bodied, dark chocolate malt, toasted coconut, vanilla, deep complex flavours. Stunning milk stout from York 🏴󠁧󠁢󠁥󠁮󠁧󠁿

Z zapasów po WFP. Złote, klarowne. Piana wysoka, trwała, lepi szkło. W aromacie owoce -  tropiki (ananas, mango, melon). W smaku wysoka, wyraźna, trochę zalegająca goryczka. Wytrawne. Średnie wysycenie.
Alcohol taste.medium bodied. High carbonated. Very clear appereance and good foam. Lots of flavours. Spicy, banana wheat vanilla notes. Rich yeast taste
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Gylden. Litt uklar. Skumring. Lett bæraroma. Smaken mere bær. Lett tørr & søt avslutning.
# 1139; 7/2018. Výborný doppelbock. Hezky vazký, plný sladkého ovoce. Ač v chuti patrný alkohol, velmi dobře pitelný.
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Gusjegråbrun. 0 skum. Aroma av malt & fersken. Smaken tørket frukt. Lett tørr avslutning.

Bottle 33cl. @home poured into a shaker. Hazy pale golden, good frothy white head, good retention and lacing. Aroma sweet malt, grain, light citrus, grass. Taste medium sweet and bitter, malty, grainy, light metallic, hint lemon. Medium body, oily texture, average carbonation, dry sweetbitter aftertaste, light herbal and mineral notes, refreshing lager, okay.

Flaska från Hopt.se. Disig smutsigt gyllengul med lågt vitt skum. Ganska platt både till kropp och smakbild. Jäst, deg, surdegsbröd, lite örter. Skulle mått bra av lite sälta. Aningen syrlig. Inte dålig men på gränsen.
# 1132; 7/2018. Version 2017. Velmi dobrý weizenbock, hezky sladce meruňový a kořeněný.

Hazy yellow color with white head. Aroma is hoppy, fruity and a hint of salt. Taste is aswell fruity and a little bitter. Very good beer for the style. You dont taste it is alcohol free beer. My favourit alcohol free beer.
Bottle. Hazy deep golden color with a huge foamy white head. Mild aroma of banana and wheat. Mild wheaty taste. Medium thin body.
Keg at We Brought Beer, Tooting.  Lightly Hazy pale straw.  Spicy, herbal hop nose.  A bit more sharpness from the Chinook.  Similar in the flavour.
Cask at  Black Door. Hazy yellow colour and small steady white head. Green grass, wheat and some juicyness in the nose. Light-bodied. Pineapple, grass, sweetness. Smooth oaty palate. Nice.
Süßlich herber Beginn, angenehm, leider schnell metallern werdend. Mild würzig, trocken bitter werdend. Zum Ende stark bitter ohne weitere Aromen. 9/8/7/7/8/7
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Lysebrunt skumring. Utmerket sjokoladearoma. Smaken det samme ispedd litt vanilje.

Tiefdunkles Braun im Glas mit stabilem, hellen Schaum. In der Nase malzig, Zuckerrübensirup, Schokolade, etwas Kaffeepulver. Im Mund eine karamellige Süße, porterähnlich, vergorene Brombeeren,  Amarena-Kirsche, Schokoladenmousse, Malzsirup und im Abgang etwas bittere Kaffeenoten.

Keg at MS HW, 25/01/20.
Clear golden blonde with a decent white cap.
Nose is pale malts, grass, toasted grains, light dusting of funk, citric tinged straw.
Taste comprises hay bale, lemon rind, dusty fruit esters, grains, light farmyard elements.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Ok simple farmyard kind of affair.

Bottled October 30th with a note that says shelf life 6 months.

It pours black but not pitch black, a finger of tannish foam, excellent lacing.

I get notes of coffee leaning towards a coffee grounds bitterness. Milky is definitely present.

Lots of coffee and milk in the taste, bringing both bitter and sweet flavours. The finish has some chocolate to it. Quite the tasty beer.

Medium bodied with lightish carbonation.

Nice.
Keg @ Smithfield Market Tavern, Manchester.  Copper-red with a small head.  It's a red berry sweetened lager with a mid carbonation.
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Mørk gyldenbrun. Så vidt litt skumring. Beskjeden sitrusaroma. Smaken tørket frukt. Lett tørr bitter avslutning.

Cask @ Crown & Kettle, Manchester.  Smooth hoppy and dangerously easy in the palate for its strength, in part due to its watery-clean texture, it's not thin though.  There's a hint of milkshake sweetness.  Golden with a creamy head and a mild spice develops in the palate.
500 ml bottle. Cloudy dark orange, big fluffy head. Citrus, yeast, bread, banana, a bit clove and pineapple. Mild dryness. Medium bodied, oily texture, lively to soft carbonated, dry finish. Good!

A really nice porter with coffee and chocolate malt in the aroma. Poured dark mahogany body with scummy lace top. Taste is sweet chocolate and bitter coffee with a smooth transition and good bitter finish. In fact I just convinced myself to raise it a point for taste. Palate is medium bodied, smooth texture, average to soft carbonation and a bitter finish. Far above some other cask porters but I have been spoiled by craft flavour and a longstanding bias towards fruit porters over coffee.
On tap at the brewpub. Deep gold with a fine foam and a distinct honey nose. Sweet and malty, mild bitterness, a little sweet overall but very drinkable.
Medium smoke, but it is quite pleasant. Underlying super crisp light bodied lager. Online hier gibt bier

Poured dark brown amber with tan lace top. Aroma of brown bread and light berry hops. Taste is medium sweet initially with fruity and toffee notes. Sour finish. Palate is medium bodied oily texture average carbonation and a souring mash finish. Expected something else from an old ale more richness in the finish, perhaps.
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Gyldengul. Filmskum. Nesten klar. Lett ferskenaroma. Smaken plommer & vanilje. Lett tørr avslutning.

Beer Names: North Brewing Co Dazed and Awake
Reviews: A small taste from a friend (can) @ One Pint Pub. Pours hazy yellow with a medium head. Aroma is sweet and dank malts with some fruits. Flavor is sweet and dank juicy malts with some hops. Very good.
Cask at GBBF Winter 2020, near black with a loose tan foam, malty sweet and roasty nose, fruity and sweet with a burnt edge, malty-dry on the finish. A little cloying but very nice.
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Gyldengul. Filmskum. Blomsteraroma. Smaken papp & blomster. Litt tett avslutning.
Lilly bouquet. Clear golden, thick head, good lace. Lilly, grapefruit, rosehip. Medium body, easy carbonation.
Cask at GBBF Winter 2020 with Rune & Finn, hay red-brown with a loose foam, lightly acetic nose, fresh and cleansing, then tart and earthy-fruity, mild for sour and very quafffable.
V 100 piv. Vyrazna silna visnova vona. Visnova tmava farba ruzovkasta pena. Chut kyselkasta visnova prijemna. Dlho sa drzi
440ml can. Crisp, chewy hoppy and juicy tropical fruity with some pine, herbal notes, hints of grass, floral notes and citrus. Pretty good.
Very good papaya smell...taste is a malty IPA with medium strength papaya that's covered up by the thick malt and medium hops...finishes dry and bitter
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune & BeerViking. Dyp brun. Syrlig fruktaroma. Smaken syrlig. Plommer. Tørr avslutning.

On tap at 100 pív.
Pours ruby with pink head. 
Sour cherry on a nose. Dry, sourish, sour cherries, bit of barique feel. Tasty
Taster at taproom. Rich, golden body with a fine layer of foam. Aroma and taste offer a deep malt bill with a gentle layer of bittering hops. Big and bready with a small crisp bite.
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Gusjegråbrun. Filmskum. Uklar. Lett bæraroma. Smaken fjøs. Ettersmaken det samme.

Beer Names: Anchor Our Special Ale (2005 and later)
Reviews: mørk brun, treaktig, tørket frukt, krydret..................................
lys strågul, korn, lett frisk anonym og tynn uten usmaker...................
440ml can. Almost black with a tan head. Aroma of roast malts, ashy, dark chocolate. Taste is very roasty, ashy, dark chocolate, molasses. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel.
Cask at GBBF Winter 2020, deep brown with a lasting fine ring, plummy and berry nose with hints of cocoa leads into a dusty dry-bitter and tangy body. Nice!

355 ml can.
Pours clear copper color with a large head. Nice resinous hoppy aroma with pine notes, slightly malty, some orange and citrus as well as some mango. Flavor is resinous hoppy, some caramel tones, mouthwatering citrus, hop oily slick palate, malty bitter finish. Alcohol is barely noticeable here, great balance between resinous hops and bitter malts. Great.
4616
1/2 pint on tap @ One Pint Pub. Pours hazy yellow with a medium creamy head. Aroma is sweet fruity malts. Flavor is sweet malts with some fruity notes and some hops. Good.

Draft. An unclear golden beer with a lazing beige head. The aroma has notes of spices, hops, citrus fruits, and malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of hops, citrus fruits, spices, and malt, leading to a bitter finish.

Bottle split at L6 at the Tipple's had tasting, thanks to LKS, 17/04/19.
Extremely dark mahogany brown with a lasting beige cap.
Nose is fruit cake, toffee, charr, brown sugars, dusty fruits, light spice.
Taste comprises stewed fruits, brown sugars, dates, figs, dark malts, molasses, toffee, fruit loaf.
Medium plus bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a light boost.
Ok BW.

Kolor ciemno bursztynowy, może nawet bordowy, opalizujący. Piana barwy ecru, wysoka, o średnim czasie redukcji.
Aromat słodki i wytrawny zarazem, są ciemne suszone owoce, śliwy, figi, daktyle, są rodzynki. Dalej słodka słodowość, ciemny chleb. Po delikatnym ogrzaniu pojawiają się akcenty winne, winogrona, czerwone owoce.
Smak idzie w kierunku winnego, jest lekko kwaskowy, wytrawny, są czerwone owoce, winogrona, wiśnie. Słodowość jest nieco wycofana, choć dalej czuć ciemne owoce. Ponownie ciemne pieczywo, pumpernikiel, trochę akcentów ziemistych.
Alkohol tylko na początku delikatnie rozgrzewał. Wysycenie średnie. Sporo ciała. Piwo jest bardzo gładkie, miękkie.

Beer Names: Dieu du Ciel! Péché Mortel Mexicaine
Reviews:
Glass, 5-ounce, draught, gift from Mathieu Vidal, drunk at the St-Jérôme brewery, savoured on February 2, 2019; eye: black, ring of brown head, opaque, no lacing; nose: spices, spicy cake, light vanilla, coffee, light roast, fresh; mouth: spices, spicy cake, light vanilla, coffee, light roast, fresh, tangy finale, full body, medium carbonation, lightly sweet, tangy texture; overall: nice surprise
 

FRANÇAIS

Verre, 5 onces, en fût, bue à la brasserie de St-Jérôme, savourée le 2 février 2019; œil : noire, anneau de mousse brune, opaque, pas de dentelle; nez : épices, gâteau épicé, léger vanille, café, léger torréfaction, frais; bouche : épices, gâteau épicé, léger vanille, café, léger torréfaction, frais, finale piquante, corsée, carbonatation moyenne, légèrement sucrée, texture piquante; en résumé : belle surprise

Sierra Nebmvada really knows how to celebrate an anniversary. Their 40th IPA is truly a victory of brewing. It's a balanced affair that channels their west coast pedigree while still delivering interest and quality. A solid light malt backbone lifts an impressive resiny piney hop bill that is both familiar and engaging at the same time.  Nice long hoppy finish that still manages to avoid rindiness. Quite clean. Awesome lacing too. This is why they are the west coast kings.
keg at monties... soft passion orange green hop nose... Light dry green hop.. long dru tropical fruit... soft sharp dry fruit

Bottle split at L6 at the Tipple's had tasting, thanks to Leighton, 17/04/19.
Mahogany brown with a well presented beige covering.
Nose is dried fruits, dates, toffee, dark malts, light oak, spice.
Taste comprises fruit cake, dried prunes, spice, dark malts, hint of rum, earthy, dates, stewed fruits.
Medium plus bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a lick of booze.
Decent Quad.

330 ml bottle.  Pours dark red with tall, long lasting, fluffy beige head and nice lacing.  Aroma is of bready malt, sweet cherries and  caramel.  Body is full, creamy and slightly crisp.  Taste is of caramel malt, herbal hops and cherries.  Finish is long, almost dry. Nice brew.

Can split at L6 at the Tipple's had tasting, from a trade with some jaun I imagine, 17/04/19.
Clear golden with a decent off white cap.
Nose is pale malts, straw, toasted grains, light bread dough.
Taste comprises pale and bready malts, toasted grains, grass, lemon zest, cereals.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Not bad.
Can from Liberty store. Pours black lots of head and lacing. Notes are milk chocolate, roasted marshmallows, coffee. Big sweet, medium bitter. Creamy body medium carbonation.

Murky golden orange pour with one finger off-white head. Some citrus and fruit in the aroma/flavor. Bright, grassy and a touch zesty. Overall, somewhat muted and one dimensionsal. I enjoyed it but wouldn't go back.
Can smell the cream, pineapple and some coconut. Get mostly cream and some sweet pineapple. Decent.

16 oz. Aroma is Smarties, Tang, oranges, bready. Pours hazy golden with large-ish chunks of sediment floating around; has a one finger bone-white head with decent retention. Taste has a moderate pithy  bitterness, a light to moderate sweetness, with flavors of Tang and oranges, peel and pulp, vanilla. Not bad.
An excellent example of a style I really enjoy. Light, crisp with a nice hop profile.
Cask @ City Arms, Manchester.  Fuller hazed yellow-amber with a frothy head.  Has a citrus hoppiness, evident in both aroma and taste.

Sampled from the tap at the brewery. Pours a cloudy earthy yellow with a white head that dissipates slowly to the edges. Aroma has dank papaya and citrus with a strong onion note supporting. Flavor is onion forward with dank papaya and bitter citrus underlying.

Draught. Pours clear dark amber with a medium, creamy off-white head, medium retention with good lacing. Moderate grapefruit and resin hops, moderate hop bitterness, medium honey and toast malt with a dry finish. Medium-full body and medium carbonation.

Dark black with a large khaki head and nice lacing. Nose is bourbon barrel, banana bread, toffee, and roast. Flavor is really smooth and easy going for the percent. Coconut barrel, fudge, char, and more roasted malt. Medium bodied, and not too sticky for the style.

Draught. Pours clear black with a medium, frothy off-white head, short retention. Medium rich roast and caramel malt, dates and figs, light hop bitterness, and a medium dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.
Can. Dark golden, slightly cloudy. Hop aroma with some malt.  Really good. Strong, with good but not the very strong hop flavor many DIPAs have.

Pours thick black with thin dark tan head. Aroma is cocoa, maple syrup, roast and cinnamon. Taste is chocolate, maple syrup and brown sugar, moving to cinnamon and roast. Finish is chocolate, maple syrup and cinnamon.

Draught. Pours clear yellow with a medium, frothy white head, long retention with good lacing. Medium rich biscuit malt, medium citrus hops and hop bitterness, a clean lager character, and a dry finish. Light body and medium carbonation.

Black appearance with a bubbly tan head. Aroma of toasted oak, roasted malt, bitter chocolate and light earthy notes. Similar flavor, oaky and roasty with mild sweetness and mild bitterness. Medium to full body with a soft feel and a lingering woody finish.

Very malt-forward for an American wheat ale, with an outsized toasted bread and caramel backbone overshadowing the more gentle grassy, fruit-tinged notes of the style. Hints of lemon and orange backed up by mild floral hops offset the malt, but it's hard to find much balance or nuance. Not bad, but not what you'd expect.

Gold pour, little haze, finger of white head.  Nose is citrus and grain.  Middle is blood orange (not to strong), light berry, some melon, little spice, light kilned malt. Finish is fruity and yeasty.  Nice mouthfeel for the ABV.

Draught. Pours clear black with brown highlights and a medium, frothy beige head, medium retention with good lacing. Moderate roast malt, bitter malt and hops, dark fruits of raisins and plums, and a dry finish. Medium-full body and medium carbonation.

Beer Names: Four Saints Rye, Oh Rye IPA
Reviews:
This is one beautiful beer.  Amazing 
bright clear reddish brown.  Thick off white head.  Plenty of lace.  The rye is in the front in both aroma and flavor.  Lots of resiny pine as well.  Very earthy hop bill. Starts with a bitter smack  Some leathery notes and lots of toffee and caramel malt unfold next. A long earthy bitter fade follows with some citrus and berry notes. Excellent.

On tap at Ellyn's Tap & Grill in Glen Ellyn, IL. dispensed to only a snifter showing an ultra cloudy, pulpy orange color, with a presentable layer of soft white froth, and a sheeting band of lacing. The nose was rather expressive, with mild dankness, citrus, tropical fruit as pineapple & mango, creaminess, sweetness, and a touch of vanilla. Medium bodied, the taste was similar, the sweetness & cream seemed to disappear, as the carbonation was rather low, thus prompting the notion of thinning texture. Bitterness was fruity, rind-like, pulpy, and earthy, with some dryness to the finish. All the right notes in the wrong proportions. Also, not necessarily snifter worthy for the price point.
Keg @ Jack In the Box at Mackie Mayor, Manchester.  Golden with a creamy-frothy head.  Has a light Helles styling, but is evident enough with perhaps its crispness its best feature.
Cask @ Abel Heywood, Manchester.  Darker brew with a small head. It's not overly fruity but the actual blackberry is evident within its taste.

AR: (kratziger) Hopfen, Zitrus, Tropenfrucht, pfeffrig, 
AP: milchigtrübes weissgelb
TA: (kratziger) Hopfen, Tropenfrucht, Zitrus, Hefe

Tap at Hole in The Wall (Raglan outside bar).    Dark brown almost black pour big frothy Guinness like head.  Nose is light earthy chocolate.  Tastes of light malt, rootbeer, roast and hint of dark chocolate.  Thin and dry.   I’m hungover so this is pleasant way to get back into life.

750-ml caged and corked bottle purchased at the brewery in Brossard, Quebec, Canada. Pours pitch black yet with the tiniest bit of mahogany hightlights, along with a trace of brown head and lots of clingy lacing. Aroma: coffee, chocolate, dark dried fruits, smoke. Flavor: espresso, milk chocolate, campfire marshmallows, prunes, raisin bread, date bars, figs, molasses cookies, burnt toast; perfectly balanced between sweet and bitter. Mouthfeel: full-bodied with a velvety smooth, creamy yet oily finish.

Clear rich golden with a thick rocky white head. Nice aroma of sticky dank earthy pineapple and a little piney resin. Crisp bright golden malty flavor with nice pineapple and resiny aromas with little bitterness. Smooth and balanced and quaffable.
Cask @ Fox & Goose, Hebden Bridge.  Light golden with a small head.  Hoppy ale with a brooding fruitiness somewhere in the background, and some malty-bitterness in its aftertaste.

On Tap at the Boise brewery/taproom.  Hazy deep orange light amber with a thin wispy soapy of white head.  Some deep resinous piney hops in the aromas and flavors. Big citrus pithiness as well.  Late light malty cereal flavors.   Medium bodies and a little ABV burn in there.

Beer Names: Silver Moon Barrel Aged Xul Blend
Reviews: Draught. Pours opaque jet black with a medium, frothy beige head, short retention. Moderate rich chocolate, toffee, and caramel malt, sweet cinnamon and vanilla, tobacco notes, dark fruits, and a sweet finish. Full body and medium carbonation.

Draught. Pours clear, nearly opaque black with a medium, frothy beige head, short retention. Moderate rich chocolate, medium roast malt, tart raspberries, and a dry finish. Full body and medium carbonation.
Draught. Pours lightly hazy gold with a medium, frothy white head, short retention. Moderate tart and acidic passion fruit, light cracker malt and a dry finish. Light body and carbonation.

Draught. Pours clear gold with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention with spotty lacing. Medium grainy sweet bready malt, light spicy and floral hops and hop bitterness, light sulfur, and a dry finish. Light body and medium carbonation

16 oz can from Total Wine and More in Short Pump, VA  No brewer name on the label  This was a difficult beer to classify.  Others have it as a Sour -Weisse.  The sour poured a cloudy amber color with a big white head that quickly dissipated.  The sour aroma of beer but really on the best I have had. The sour has a medium body with soft carbonation.  The finish is clean with a mouthfeel of pleasant sourness.

Delt med Rune på rom 410 Premier Inn Waterloo, Birmingham. Svart. Middels høyt lysebrunt skum som daler sakte og etterlater litt lacing. Lakrisaroma. Silkemyk munnfølelse. Smaken nøtter & sjokolade. Tørr avslutning. Litt alkohol kommer fram.

Draught. Pours clear black with a medium, frothy beige head, long retention. Moderate citrus, pine, and resin hops and hop bitterness, minty notes, roast and chocolate malt with a dry finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation.

Draught. Pours clear orange with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention. Heavy citrus, tropical fruit, and melon hops and hop bitterness, medium bread malt, and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Draught. Pours clear gold with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention with light lacing. Moderate rich coffee, chocolate notes, light biscuit malt, and a dry finish. Medium-light body and moderate carbonation.

On tap at Big Dog's, I assume the pom in the name refers to pomegranate as this had a nice light fruit flavor. Definitely didn't see the 9%.  I liked this quite a bit, but I have a bias towards pomegranate beer.
On tap at Big Dog's, this was super sweet. The sugar was just off the charts. A bit creamy but just too sweet to enjoy.  A rare miss for Able Baker, imo.

Beer Names: Hopfenhäcker Isle of Islay Rum Smokey Sten
Reviews: Sampled @ Braukunst Live 2020. A very dark brown beer with a beige head. Aroma of bourbon, rum Barrel, dark roasted malt. Taste of dark roasted malt, coffee, burned malt rum barrel.
Sampled @ Braukunst Live 2020. A slightly hazy yellow golden beer with a white head. Aroma of sweet banana, quite yeasty. Taste of sweet banana, yeast, some phenols, quite sweet.

Sampled @ Braukunst Live 2020. A slightly hazy dark amber beer with a off white head. Aroma of strong caramelized malt, red malt, caramel, honey. Taste of strong caramelized malt, honey, riped fruits, boozy.

Beer Names: Glen Affric Speyside BA Black Brose
Reviews: Puszka. Czarny kolor. Piana beżowa,średnia opada dość szybko. W zapachu raczej nikłe nuty whiskey, można złapać ulotne akcenty beczki i palonej kawy,palony słód. Delikatna tekstura i raczej małe wysycenie przypominają bardziej stouta niż portera. W smaku kawa,delikatna whiskey ,beczkowe nuty,lekki tytoń li skóra. Bardzo fajne...zobaczymy co się stanie po ogrzaniu..chyba tylko więcej goryczki,brykietu i tytoniu..

Draught. Pours clear brown with a small, frothy off-white head, short retention. Moderate rich chocolate coffee notes, roast and bread malt, light hop bitterness, and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Draught. Pours clear gold with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention with light lacing. Medium acidity, tart peaches, light almond notes, light bread malt, and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Puszka. Czarny kolor. Piana zbita,beżowa,o średniej wysokości ,ładnie utrzymuje się w szkle. W zapachu mleczna czekolada,lekkie nuty masła orzechowego,kawa Inka. W smaku podobnie ,słodka ,mleczna czekolada,kawa słaba...Inka. ślady wytrawnego kakao..z lekka goryczka. piwo ratuje kremowa konsystencja i bardzo delikatne wysycenie...mimo wszystko jest raczej ok niż wow...

Draught. Pours clear orange with a medium, frothy off-white head, medium retention with light lacing. Moderate bitter orange pith hops, medium herbal and savory bergamot, medium biscuit malt and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Im Geruch malzig süßlich. Goldgelbes klares Bier, schnell einfallende grobe Schaumkrone. Der Antrunk ist süßlich hopfig-malzig. Traditioneller Hopfen im Aroma. Sehr mild, kaum bitter. Leichte Säure. Feinperlig. Relativ eintönig, leistet sich jedoch keine geschmacklichen Fehler. Besser als das typische Durchschnitts-Export.

Keg at MS HW, 06/02/20.
Black with a tan cap that veers edgeward.
Nose is dark malts, cocoa powder, toffee, dried fruits, light charr, mellow roast, light coffee.
Taste comprises sweet malts, chocolate, pecan nut, caramel melt, toffee fudge, light booze tunes, brown sugars, mellow roast.
Full bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a balanced rising boost level.
Ok easy drinking impy, ABV considered, but lacks a little depth and struggles to pull out of third gear.

Keg at MS HW, 06/02/20.
Almost clear golden with a decent lasting just off white head.
Nose is orange peel, citric tinged straw, toasted malts, lemon drizzle, light pine, melon.
Taste comprises orange zest, citric sherbets, grass, light pine, hint floral, melon, tangerine.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close spiked with juicy to grassy hop bitterness.
Decent well balanced session gear.

Beer Names: Blue Spruce Belgian Holiday Spiced Ale
Reviews: December 14th, 2015 - The smell of Christmas hangs heavy over this hazy, cinnamon colored beer. Vanilla and custard tease rich desserts, while cinnamon and clove give the scent it's holiday cheer. The flavor is weaker than the aroma, with an odd tanginess, but I do find comfort in the brusque, rye focused aftertaste.

Beer Names: North Brewing Co Tunnels Of LA
Reviews:
Draught at Mikkeller Bar Viktoriagade.
Clear golden coloured with a small white head.
Fruity aroma of hops and citrus.
Fruity flavour of hops and citrus.
Hoppy finish.
Bag-in-Box. På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Grågul. Luftig skumring. Stikkende pærearoma. Smaken maling. Ikke god. Forsiktig tørr avslutning.
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Gylden. 0 skum. Smørmaltaroma. Smaken mye smørmalt. Litt fersken. Lett tørr avslutning.

Beer Names: J.W. Lees The Boilerhouse Brandy Snap Stout
Reviews: Pint @ The Boathouse,Chester .Czarny kolor. Piana raczej nieśmiała,biała,kremowa,opadła szybko. W aromacie delikatne nuty brandy lecz dominują dziwne ziołowe akcenty. W smaku ponownie oprócz delikatnej kawy i czekolady nie ma zbyt wiele w ofercie. Można by powiedzieć że pije się DR. Peppera...jest ziołowo,taka cola na sterydach. Mało ciała,wodniste...raczej nie weszło.

Cask @ Bear & Billet ,Chester. Mętne o złotym kolorze. Piana biała,zbita,opada dość szybko. W aromacie cytrusy,mix tropików i lekkie nuty żywicy. W smaku ponownie spora dawka cytrusów ale w słodkim wydaniu ,tropiki z ananasem na czele,morele,mango,,lekka teina. Średnia goryczka,średnie wysycenie. Weszło bardzo fajnie..

Beer Names: Glen Affric / Black Lodge Over The Water
Reviews: Puszka. Złoty kolor. Piana średnia,biała,opada szybko do pierścienia. W aromacie tropiki,słodkie cytrusy, trochę chlebowych nut. W smaku ponownie słodkie akcenty mango i marakuji, mandarynki i czerwony grejpfrut, ciastka Średnia goryczka i lekko oleiste tekstura. Dość spora dawka alkoholu ,który w końcowej fazie "niewinnie" rozgrzewa. Porządne i bez zbędnych fajerwerków

Pours black with a small tan head. The aroma is of roast malt, coffee, and bourbon. The flavor has a pretty balanced bourbon taste that goes well with the roast malt, coffee, and chocolate. Full body. Very good.
This amber brew smells of toasted caramel malt. It has a pretty assertive flavor the style with the caramel joined by a good hops bite. It's still easy drinking and overall is an enjoyable brew.

Beer Names: Burns Family Artisan Ales Genie^Logical V2 Apple and Sunflower
Reviews: On tap at Burns Family poured a clear yellow with a lasting creamy white head. Aromas of straw, nuttiness, light apple and light yeast. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a dry tart finish. Flavors of straw, apples, light nuttiness and light citrus with a crisp dry tart lingering apple finish.
Tap. Hazy amber color with white head. Aroma is juicy fruits, oxidized, peach. Taste is sweet creamy, juicy fruits. Oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation. Not for me.
Tap. Hazy brown color with beige head. Aroma is cherries, chocolate, mildly roasty. Taste is the same, a bit bready. Thick mouthfeel, medium carbonation. Alright.
Tap. Hazy golden-orange color with white head. Aroma is bready, grapefruit. Taste is bready, sweetish fruits, peach. Oily mouthfeel with medium carbonation.

Tap. Unclear golden color with white head. Aroma is exotic fruits, jammy, white sugar. Taste is fruity, white sugar, Maibock-style, a bit estery but not too much. Oily mouthfeel with medium carbonation. Nice!
Tap. Hazy golden color with white head. Aroma is peach, white pepper, fruity. Taste is dank, peach, white pepper, dough. Silky mouthfeel with medium carbonation. I like!

Cask at By the Horns Brewery, Summerstown.  A light golden bitter.  These Bullian hops are a little spicy and savoury, which gives the beer a fairly unusual flavour.  I just think it’s a bit too weak a beer to properly balance out the hop flavours.

Beer Names: Bitburger / Sierra Nevada Triple Hop'd Lager
Reviews: Tap. Hazy golden color with eggshell head. Aroma is a bit buttery, fruity hops. Taste is a bit buttery, not in the bad way. Thick creamy mouthfeel with soft carbonation.
Sample at BKL2020. Cloudy amber, off-white head, dry fruitbread aromatics, caramel medium full dry, fruit sirup, lightest booze, a hint chalk, nice tropical retronasal. Good.
Bottle. Unclear golden color with white head. Aroma is wheat, peach, a bit dusty. Taste is the same. Oily mouthfeel with low carbonation. Not quite for me.

Beer Names: Hopfenhäcker Isle of Islay Rum Smokey Sten
Reviews: Tap. Clear golden color with soapy beige head. Aroma is intense rum, mild smoke, chocolate. Taste is the same, surprisingly drinkable. Silky mouthfeel with low carbonation. Nice one!

Beer Names: Hopfenhäcker Isle of Islay Rum Smokey Sten
Reviews: Sample at BKL2020. Dark brown, off-white golden foam, perfumed smoky iodine nose, mellow sparkly dry smoked base, vanilla barrel and toasted finish, nice!
Sampled at BKL2020. Nice fruity hop nose, cloudy dark yellow, white lace, mellow medium body, dry fruits, fresh, lychee citruspeel. Nice.

Beer Names: Bitburger / Sierra Nevada Triple Hop'd Lager
Reviews: Tap at BKL2020. Leafy green light spice, medium mellow, light butter, grain, croissant, leafy hops, a hint copper. very fresh and  pleasant.
Sampled @ Braukunst Live 2020. A black beer with a beige lacing. Aroma of sweet coffee beans, dark roasted malt. Taste of fresh roasted coffee beans, vanilla. Nice!
31-01-20 // taster at Braukunst Live! in Munich. Lovely coffee aromas. Rich in taste and fullbodied. Rum not so really present. But I do like it.

Beer Names: Ancient City Augustine's Orange Amber Ale
Reviews: Aroma : Light caramel malt, unusual sweet orange note rather than citrus orange.  Taste : Malt is sublte, sweet orange comes through and although not overpowring, for me lacks some bittering balance. Still an o.k. beer though (Florida tour Nov 2018)

Draught. Pours clear brown with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention with good lacing. Moderate rich bready, biscuit, and toasted grain malt, dark fruits, and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Draught. Pours clear dark gold with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention with good lacing. Medium rich bready malt, sulfur notes, medium floral and spicy hops, medium hop bitterness, and a dry finish. Light body and moderate carbonation.

From can to pint glass.  Aromas of citrus and lemon.  Slight grainy malt.  Crystal clear pale yellow with sustained, small white head.  Beautiful beer.  Flavor is lemon cake and slight curd.  Dry finish, follows through to a nice carbonic bite.  Very good beer.

Draught. Pours clear black with brown highlights and a medium, frothy beige head, short retention. Moderate rich chocolate and coffee, light nuttiness, and a medium dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.
Draught. Pours clear dark brown with a medium, frothy off-white head, short retention. Medium rich toasted bread malt, cinnamon, vanilla, and cocoa with a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.
Draught. Pours clear gold with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention. Moderate orange and melon hops, medium hop bitterness, medium bread malt, and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Cloudy pale gold pour with a one finger white head. Aroma is very lemony and tart floral. Flavor is juicy lemon-lime citrus, straw, pale malt, wildflower. Light body, dry feel light carbonation. Good stuff, interesting hop profile.

Draught. Pours hazy dark amber with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention. Moderate orange and fruit hops, honeydew and cantaloupe notes, light bread malt, medium hop bitterness and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Draught. Pours hazy orange with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention with good lacing. Moderate orange and dank hops and hop bitterness, medium bread malt, and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Draught. Pours hazy orange with a medium, frothy off-white head, long retention with light lacing. Moderate fresh grassy and herbal hops, medium bread malt, funky Brettanomyces, and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Draught. Pours hazy orange with a large, creamy white head, long retention with good lacing. Moderate lime and orange, medium tartness and acidity, medium bread malt, and a dry finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation.

Bottle with much love to Scott, the facilitator of all good things.  Pours a deep, dark brown (thin looking liquid though) with a thin head.  Aromas of leather, charcoal, and coffee.  Flavor is a nice and clean stout with a touch of bourbon, coffee, and smoky charcoal.  Nice and light for a beer with this much flavor.
A good hopped beer, surprisingly drinkable despite at eight weeks.  Can from the source, thanks Brian.
Can. Clear golden with whitish colored bubbles. Aroma of honey, apples, and a little agave. Sweet with a hint of tart. Medium bodied with a touch of fizz on the tongue. Well done.

Beer Names: The Ale Apothecary Bergamont La Tache
Reviews: Cask. Pours clear golden orange with a bubbly white head, short retention. Moderate savory bergamot flowers, oregano, light tartness, medium bread malt, and a dry finish. Medium body and light carbonation.

On tap at Champps in Brookfield. 2019 version! Very dark brown pour. Aroma has sweet barrel, cinnamon, some chiles, sweet malts. Taste is of cinnamon, sweet barrel, cherry, sweet malts, and tangy chiles. Well done and tasty. The chiles provide a solid heat. Medium to full bodied, with some alcohol presence, the blend is good. This does not have the typical Darkness full body, but still solidly supports the barrel & chiles. Unsure how this would age. Lovin the cinnamon/barrel taste blend. Finishes sweetly, with barrel & cinnamon. This has an interesting blend. Multi dimensional with the chiles. Still would like more of the typical Darkness thickness. 16.3

On tap at Champps in Brookfield - In a teku! Go Tony ... Unclear orange pour. Orange, pineapple, tropical fruit mousse with a solid dry hop presence. Super hoppy. Juicy. Pale malts. Bitter-sweet fruity finish. This is really good; hoppy, juicy, tasty. 16.6

12oz can from Three Cellars in the Falls. Dark brown pour with reddish tints. Aroma has sweet malts, berry, chocolate, and pastry filling. Taste is thicker than expected; sweet malts, raspberry, cream. Well blended and fairly tasty, staying away from getting too sweet. Medium bodied or a bit more. Finishes to the sweet side of bittersweet. Enjoyed this more than expected. 14.2

Taster at the Mothership. Pours a hazy, straw color, with a big, frothy, white head. A little lime juice, cream, lemon peel, vanilla, and a lot of floral notes. Very sweet and phenolic. Smooth, light, and silky. Delicious!
Draught. Pours clear black with a small, frothy beige head, short retention. Moderate rich coffee, light nuttiness, earthy, light hop bitterness, and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

473 ml can from the brewery. Pours a murky rhubarb colour with small pinkish head.  Aroma is tart raspberry, lemon and grains.  Flavour has tart candyish raspberry, lemon and mellow grains.  Lighter carbonation.  Decent.

Beer Names: Listermann Barrel Aged Imperial Nutcase - Chocolate Fluff
Reviews: 12 oz. bottle from the brewery. Pours a hazy dark brown with amber highlights and a layer of oil atop the liquid. The head quickly vanishes. Notes of peanut butter, chocolate, toasted marshmallows, fudge, vanilla, roast, oak, and bourbon. Medium-bodied, with low carbonation and a roasty, nutty, sweet, warming, slightly flat mouthfeel. A little messy and could use more carb, but the aroma is all roasted peanuts and that's fun. Somehow this one is more peanut buttery than others; I guess these particular adjuncts enhance that aspect.
Tap. Pours hazy yellow,  small white head,  decent lacing.  Aroma is pungent,  oranges,  armpits,  overripe peaches.  Flavor is light plus sweet,  light bitter.  Medium body.
Ohh, nice Enigma.  Tap. Pours hazy yellow,  small white head,  decent lacing.  Aroma is enigma,  perfume,  fresh pine needles,  tangerine.  Flavor is light sweet,  light bitter,  juicy.  Medium body.

500 ml bottle via trade. Pours a deep, dark, basically opaque brown with a small tan head that settles into a ring and a thin loop of film. Notes of chocolate, vanilla, strawberries, bourbon, oak, soy, figs, and roast. Medium-bodied, with low carbonation and a flat, sweet, tangy, and warming mouthfeel. It'd be better without the strawberry and with some carbonation. It's messy.

Taster at the Mothership. Pours black, with a small, tan ring. The nose is big vanilla, cinnamon, mild coffee, milk chocolate, and some toasted oak. Very sweet and decadent, with a touch of bitterness. Lovely.

Draught. Pours clear dark brown with a medium, frothy beige head, medium retention. Medium roast and chocolate malt, a clean lager character, light earthy hops and hop bitterness, and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Draught. Pours clear gold with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention. Medium grainy sweet malt, light earthy and white wine hops, light hop bitterness, a clean lager character, and a dry finish. Medium-light body and medium carbonation.
Tap. Pours hazy yellow,  small white head,  decent lacing.  Aroma is floral,  tropical,  hint of armpit,  bright, strong. Flavor is light sweet,  light bitter.  Nice.  Medium body

Taster at the Mothership. Pours an unclear, red color, with a small, off-white head. The aroma is raspberry, lemon cream, vanilla, and strawberry. Sweet and fruity, with a lovely, mellow tart flavor. Light and remarkably crisp and creamy. This is a fruity and delicious sour.

Taster at the Mothership. Pours a pale, hazy, yellow color, with a big, frothy, white head. The aroma is lemon, butterscotch, clover honey, roses, and dust. Sweet and chalky, with a lovely, mild bitterness. Light and fluffy, and refreshing.
Pours dark brown, aroma and upfront taste is a brownie but way too much smoke and charcoal flavor at the end, tap at brewery.
Pours an amber with thick white head and heavy lacing.  Lots of malt on the nose.  Mouthfeel is very heavy with pronounced bitterness.  Nuts, molasses and some metal taste.  Lasting bitter finish.
Nice hops bitter flavor and palate. Hazy deep yellow. Aroma is hops with some lactose. Flavor is sweet and fruity. Tap at brewery

Finally getting around to this a couple months late. Pours near black with frothy brown foam that settles to a thin cap, moderate lacing. Aromas are simpler than expected, mostly sweet malt, mild ginger snap and a touch of coffee. Flavors bring a vanilla sweetness to the forefront, combining with the roast character, and not much in the way of ginger snap. Very pleasant and easy drinking smoothness. Medium-light mouthfeel and a fairly clean finish. Will try again next year for sure!

Tap. Pours clear black,  small beige head,  decent lacing.  Aroma is light,  roasty,  mocha,  ash, more roast. Flavor is light plus sweet,  lighter bitter,  roasty.  Medium body,  soft mouthfeel,  low carbonation.

Draught. Pours clear orange with a medium, frothy off-white head, long retention with good lacing. Moderate fruity and pine hops, moderate hop bitterness, medium bread and dough malt, light alcohol, and a dry finish. Medium-full body and medium carbonation.

Draught. Pours clear black with a large, creamy tan head, long retention with excellent lacing. Moderate rich roast and coffee malt, medium pine and resin hops, moderate hop bitterness, and a dry finish. Medium-full body and moderate carbonation.

Tap. Pours clear hazel,  small beige head,  decent lacing.  Aroma is roast,  nutty,  dark toast,  a hint of wood,  earth.  Flavor is light plus sweet,  minimal bitterness,  nice roasty notes.  Medium body,  smooth. Good.

Tap. Pours hazy golden orange,  small off white head,  some lacing.  Aroma is light,  armpit,  coconut,  odd. Flavor is light plus sweet,  very light bitter,  green coconut.  Light plus body,  low carbonation.  Ug
Tap. Pours clear golden,  small white head,  good lacing.  Aroma is grain,  citrus,  a bit floral.  Flavor is light sweet,  light plus bitter.  Light body.

Beer Names: August Schell Shift Happens No. 1 DDH Lager
Reviews: 16 oz can pours an almost clear deep golden color with lasting off-white head that leaves some lacing.  Aroma has pine, apricot, lemon, citrus hops, and sugar.  Taste is sweet, despite the hoppiness.  Body is medium to full with perfect carbonation and a creamy mouthfeel.  I was surprised to see Schell's try something like this and sold in 16 oz. four-packs.  The can says "A transitional miniseries in four parts", so I hope to find the subsequent episodes.

Pours a deep, dark brown with a finger of tan foam that settles to a ring, no lacing. Aromas of roast malt and a slight sweetness. Flavors are more abundant with a nice sweet toffee dominating among biscuit and mild nut presence. This is how I like brown ales - with low hop bitterness and focus on the malt. Well done!

Beer Names: Woodland Empire Running on the Spot
Reviews: On Tap at the Boise brewery/taproom  Crystal clear deep golden with a touch of orange.  Thin wispy off white skin od micro bubbles. Faint very light pale malts in the aroma.  big grassy floral hop character. Feels pretty light for 7%  Well attenuated.  LIght clean finish.

Hazy deep yellow with small white head.  Aroma hay, citrus and tropical fruit.  Medium body.  Mildly bitter, some sweet juice but more on the grassy than fruit bomb side.  Found this one with a bit more intensity of flavor than their other offerings.
Can into tulip. Nice straw color with some haze. Pineapple and pine notes. Mild bitterness. Decent.
Yellow-orange, small white head.  Aroma is straightforward hops and malt, medium light body.  Flavor is mildly bitter, some malt balance, some citrus and pine, generic and acceptable.
Cloudy orange yellow.  Grassy hop aroma.  Medium body.  Alcohol well hidden.  Mildly bitter, touch of citrus and herbal hops.  It's fine.  Unmemorable.

Hazy yellow, small white head.  Aroma on the malty side.  Medium light body.  Some up front bitterness then gets a bit sweet but without the hop intensity to balance, but finishes a little better on the dry side.  Decent, style not really as advertised.

Beer Names: Stone Viking Space Probe Double IPA
Reviews: Had on tap at Tenaya Creek, this was delicious. Quite hazy, a ton of grapefruit flavors with a little orange.  This is the Stone quality I remember but had been missing in some recent average beers. This one is top notch! Tasty tasty.

Beer Names: Skyline Beer Wise Guide Brown Ale
Reviews: Dark brown with small tan head.  Aroma roasted and sweet malt.  Medium light body.  Flavor is off dry, lightly sweet malt with toasty finish.  Solid.

Beer Names: Coronado / Pizza Port South Of The Pier
Reviews: This was a pretty run of the mill.  Not a ton of bittering hops, okay flavor.  Nothing special or memorable.

Poured a hazy, light yellow colour with a bright white, creamy head. Minimal lacing. Light bouquet on the nose. With scents of cereal and light hops. First swig was really quite thin with watery flavours of very light hops, honey and a little nuts. Finish is quite plain with minimal lingering flavours.

Dark brown with small tan head.  Aroma chocolaty malt and dark fruit.  Medium light body.  Lightly sweet flavor.  It's somewhat on the lighter and fruitier style for a stout, not necessarily a bad thing, although somewhat lacking in richness.

Fresh can, pours a murky, but not soupy orange color with creamy head. Nose and flavor are Mango, residual sugar, lime, grape, fruit punch, orange blossom honey, and a touch of astringent booze in the finish. ITs pretty juicy and better than most doubles, but I think it needs a good 4-6 weeks like most cans. Medium bodied.

Draft at Bru Craft. Unexpected cloudy amber pour. Slim coat of soft off-white foam. No lace. Malty brew with some dark citrusy hops and faint florals. Poppyseed bagels. Cassia. Tangelos. Cloves. Not sure I have the right beer. Had them check and they assured me it's the right keg. Feels vaguely Belgian but not like a Saison at all.

Sampled at P house, didn't know Bolero was making real beer styles that don't cause diabetes. Clears golden with medium head. Not as bad as i expected it would be but theres some champagne type yeast notes and a touch of weird spice. Still happy to see a non lactose, pesticide fruit ridden, offering from BS.

Beer Names: Knotted Root Thick Strawberry Goo: Double Vanilla
Reviews: Hazy orange appearance with pink hues and a white head. Enticing aroma of strawberry jam, fresh vanilla, tart fruits, mild funk and light grain. Similar flavor, juicy, tart and sweet with pleasant acidity. Light body with a refreshing strawberry finish. Wow.

Dark brown appearance with a lingering tan head. Aroma of caramel malt, chocolate, mild oak, light bourbon and hints of fruit. Similar flavor, rich, malty and layered with lingering sweetness, a full body and a warming finish. Very nice.

Draft at Bru Craft. Foggy reddish orange pour with a slim dense cover of soft off-white foam. Gently tart. Cherries and oak up front. Plums. Raspberries. Currants. Kaffir lime leaves. Feels like real fruit. Juicy but not quite full. Modestly complex. Dry balanced finish.

Draft at Bru Craft. Foggy reddish orange pour with a slim dense cover of soft off-white foam. Gently tart. Cherries and oak up front. Plums. Raspberries. Currants. Kaffir lime leaves. Feels like real fruit. Juicy but not quite full. Modestly complex. Dry balanced finish.
Multiple 16 ounce cans served at the brewery. Flavor comes off danky and mild citrus like, maybe white grape hints. Some straw, bready malt. Bitterness is mild. Pretty good balance. Above average.

Not sure exactly which style to put this under, but the combination and the adjuncts sweetened up this level and basically made it taste a bit like creme brulee.  Sweet, but good, but sweeter than what I was craving last night.

16 oz draft at the brewery. Holy shit pineapple!  I love the aroma! A soft touch of pine in the finish. Soft herbs. Lower bitterness level. After drinking a bunch of this it becomes a little rindy and pulppy. Just ok for me.

Cask at Hogshead, Wolverhampton.

Pours almost black with a tight cream head.  Nose has a hint of chocolate, but not much else.  In the mouth it has a creamy texture with coffee and cherries featuring in different areas.  Finish is creamy and slightly bitter.  Extremely drinkable.

Beer Names: Shiny Cocoa and Coconut Porter Barrel Aged
Reviews:
Bottle at Beer Dock, Crewe.  Barrel aged in bourbon barrels.

Nose is strongly cocoa, plus alcoholic strength.  Pours completely black with a very dark brown transient head.  In the mouth the alcohol is to the  fore, but there is also cocoa, chocolate and hints of chilli.  Finish is boozy with a warming glow !  One for sipping slowly methinks.
14 ounce snifter draft at The Hidden Pig, Haverhill, MA. Flavor shows me grapefruit, mild herbs, malt is mildly sweet. ABV  is lightly noticeable. A tad above average.

Reddish amber appearance with a white head and pink hues. Aroma of sour funk, stone fruit and light oaky notes. Similar flavor, adding moderate acidity, light sweetness and a lingering tart/plum finish. Nice.

AR: Röstmalz, Kaffee, Holz, angebrannt
AP: trübes schwarz
TA: Röstmalz, Malzbier, Kaffee, Holz, angebrannt

On tap at brewpub

This would not have been my first choice but as it was a special release for Vintage's anniversary I rolled the dice. Unfortunately it did not deliver. In hindsight I would have happily gone for one of their other special releases rather than a rum infused sour that lacks a core identity.

AROMA / APPEARANCE
The deep reddish base and lean white head rest easily in the glass. Medicinal anise, dark fruit, and cranberry force their way into focus before slowly melting away into a mellow memory.

FLAVOR / PALATE
Cranberries, flat Dr Pepper, and shots of rum do little to generate enthusiasm once the novelty wears off. A spicy transition rushes into the tart finish with little thought for balance or continuity. First rum, then winter warmer, then anise sour, it cannot decide what facet should be its defining characteristic. As a result it is hard to recommend this unless you really need to rate everything on the menu.

On tap at brewpub

With kviek popping up more often I took the opportunity of ordering this barleywine as soon as I saw it on the menu. In this case it creates a unique experience ideal for a winter warmer. Give it some consideration if you are at the brewpub.

AROMA / APPEARANCE
Cool earthy tomato and malt ground the textures of caramel and noble hops. Even the cool coppery base and lean ivory head help tether this with a warm inviting presence.

FLAVOR / PALATE
Creamy oak, vanilla, and earthy almonds transition to a profile of dry sherry. The soothing warm finish glows on the back of the throat. The hops accent a well balanced experience that might be the best draft at Vintage right now.

On tap at brewpub

A typical New England style IPA, this polished example of the style stands out as a drinkable and accessible version that can help further understand the thought behind it. I can't say that I will be sad when hazy IPAs are in the rear view mirror but until then if most are at this level then I can enjoy the ride.

AROMA / APPEARANCE
Yeast, mango, and tropical fruit salad sticks in the air with a dense texture similar to sweet fog. If you look up the definition of the style this would be very close to ideal. The citrusy body clouds the glass like unfilitered pureed lemons decorated by a layer of white frosting.

FLAVOR / PALATE
Creamy vanilla yogurt infused with mango and oranges radiates on the tongue. The cool transition ebbs into a thick smoothie profile and eventually a vibrant bitterness. From start to finish it provides a hook that shines the stage light on a polished release. Drafts like this show that Vintage is not resting on their laurels.
Mild röstiger, süß schokoladiger Beginn. Ansteigende Herbe von geringem Level aus, rund malzig, hohe Süffigkeit. Süßlich schokoladiger Nachhall. Okay. 10/9/8/8/9/8

On tap at brewpub

A local sour fuses Wisconsin cranberries with a tangy essence to create a middle of the road kettle sour. If you enjoy your cranberry juice more abrasive than normal then source this or something like it.

AROMA / APPEARANCE
Dried cranberries and tart cherry pits tickle the senses. A mild fruity undercurrent is crisp and tart though not intensely abrasive like something from Funk Factory. Even the semitransparent reddish core resembles a cranberry influenced mocktail.

FLAVOR / PALATE
Tart cranberry lined with salty Sour Patch Kid sugar scour the tongue clean. The texture becomes more abrasive over time as it lingers in the throat. Compared to others it might be somewhat pedestrian but it does enough to be a worthwhile experience.
Sampled @ Braukunst Live 2020. A hazy dark golden beer with a white head. Aroma of orange fruits, grapefruit, fresh citrusy hops. Taste of bitter orange fruits, zest, grapefruit, long bitter finish.

Tap at the Davis Beer Shoppe. Pours clear copper with a slight head. Tropical and mildly sour aroma. Medium body. Flavor is very guava; slight tart/sour. A bit wheaty in the finish. Dry. Tart/sour. Good stuff. Like guava.
On tap at the brewery in snifter. Black color and a small tan head. Aroma is dark fruit, roasted malt, bourbon. Licorice, bourbon, roasted coffee. Full body and light carbonation. Wooooooooooow.

On tap at the brewpub. A clear orange brown beer with a beige head. Aroma is strong malty, caramel, bitter hops, soft metallic hops. Taste of strong caramelized malt, nuts, spicy and soft metallic hops.
Süßlicher, dunkel hefiger Beginn. Viel Banane, milde Herbe, die Süße nimmt etwas ab. Etwas monoton, was aber nicht schlimm ist, da die Aromatik passt. Mittellanger Abgang. 9/8/9/8/7/8
On tap at the brewpub. A clear dark orange brown beer with a beige head. Aroma of dark caramelized malt and some liquorice. Taste of mild roasted dark malt, toffee, liquorice. Okay!
On tap at the brewpub. A slightly hazy bright golden beer with a white head. Aroma of spicy hops, pale malt, straw. Taste of moderate sweet pale malt, straw, soft metallic hops.
On tap at the brewpub. A clear amber beer with a white lacing. Aroma of bitter orange fruits, grapefruit, zest. Taste of fresh fruity hops, orange fruits, zest, grapefruit.
On tap at the brewpub. A dark brown beer with a beige head. Aroma of sweet dark malt, liquorice, toffee. Taste of dark roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, some liquorice. Good!
On tap at the brewpub. A murky orange golden beer, no head. Aroma of tart red fruits, berries, brett, honey. Taste of sour red fruits, grapes, wine, honey, herbs. Interesting!

Keg at Brewdog Canary wharf. A clear golden coloured pour with a loose white head. Aroma is light grassy otsnge, corn, midget gems hop, tangerine. Flavour is composed of dry grains, bresdy, orange rind, light grass, mineral. Palate is semi sweet, crisp, highish carbonation, semi dry finish. Decent.
Can from Hoptimism. Lightly hazy deep amber colour with a thick off white head. Aroma earthy, light spice and slight fruity. Taste dry and fruity sweet. Full body.

04-02-2020; bottle; at home (bought at de Bodega, Capelle Aan den IJssel, The Netherlands).
04-02-2020; bottle; at home (bought at de Bodega, Capelle Aan den IJssel, The Netherlands).
The looks of the beer are nice. It is a decent looking Belgian Blond. The colour is a nice golden yellow, with a pleasant amber touch. It glows golden. It has a slight haziness. On top of the beer a nice smooth layer of white foam is formed. Foam retention is average. A nice drape is left on top of the beer. It looks very pleasant. 
The aroma of the beer is very nice. It is a typical Belgian Ale. The malts are nice and a bit caramel and also fruity. Touch of bread is there too. Very pleasant. The hops are floral and a bit herbal. The floral bouquet goes well with the malt notes. The herbal notes go well with the yeast aromas. These are spicy and also fruity, with some typical notes of banana. Very pleasant. 
The taste of the beer also is very nice. It is perfectly balanced. The malts are sweet and the creamy yeast gives an extra nice smooth touch to this. The hops are nice and bitter. The bitters and sweets are in perfect harmony. Really good. The palate of the beer is nice too. Medium body, smooth texture and very nice high carbonation. The finish of the beer is nice and is filled with smooth and subtle floral and herbal hop notes and some of that spicy yeast. All in all, a very nice beer. Absolutely more towards the top of the specter than the bottom. I like it.
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Svart. Mokkafarget skumring. Lett lakrisaroma. Smaken balansert. M>elkesjokolade. Lakris. Kakao i en langvarig avslutning.

Zlatnozute boje, bez pjene. Skoro bez arome, samo blago neugodne metalne i arome vlaznog kartona, kruška neprimjetna. Slatko, kratkog slatkog finiša. Vodene teksture, jake karbonizacije. Veliki promašaj, čak ni ne liči na regularni radler!

Had this at Braukunst Bier Festival Live, Friday 31st January 2020. Hazy yellowy gold with a white head, this is fruity but also very hoppy, thoroughly enjoyed this, there is a pleasant pithiness, citrus throughout.
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Lys gylden. Filmskum. Bæraroma. Smaken melon & jordbær. Lett tørr avslutning.

Had this at Braukunst Bier Festival, München Live, Friday 31st January 2020.  Pours dark brown with a slim off white, light beige head. Really pokey but very drinkable, chocolate, in fact lots of chocolate, some spirit, tastes very good.

Sampled @ Braukunst Live 2020. A hazy deep amber beer with a small beige head. Aroma of whiskey barrel, wood, strong caramelized malt. Taste of strong caramelized reddish brown malt, liquorice, caramel, wood, some whiskey.

Beer Names: Bitburger / Sierra Nevada Triple Hop'd Lager
Reviews: Sampled @ Braukunst Live 2020. A clear golden beer with a white head. Aroma of dry grassy bitter hops, hay, citra. Taste of fresh grassy and citrusy hops, pale malt, easy to drink and good!
Sampled @ Braukunst Live 2020. A slightly hazy yellow golden beer with a white head. Aroma of sweet caramelized malt, toffee. Taste of sweet yellow fruits, caramel Bonbons, toffee.

Sampled @ Braukunst Live 2020. A hazy dark golden beer with a big off white head. Aroma of orange fruits, zest, grapefruit. Taste of bitter grapefruit, zest, tangerine, resinous bitter hops. Long bitter finish. Good.
Sampled @ Braukunst Live 2020. A hazy bright golden beer with a white head. Aroma of sweet banana, yeast, moderate bitter hops. Taste of strong banana, yeast, fruity bitter hops. Strong body!

Draft. An amber beer with a lazing beige head. The aroma has notes of spices, yeast, malt, and caramel. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, caramel, fruit, yeast, spices, and malt, leading to a dry spicy finish.
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Gylden. Filmskum. Lett sitrusaroma. Smaken appelsin. Tynn. Lett tørr avslutning.

2018 bomber poured a clear dark reddish brown with a lingering ring of brown foam. Aromas of roastiness, bitter chocolate, bourbon, fruitiness and light oak. Palate was light to medium bodied and smooth with a dry finish. Flavors of roastiness, bitter chocolate, bourbon, fruitiness and light licorice with a smooth dry lingering roasty chocolate finish.
on tap at the brewpub in Fishtown - nice dark color. Roast aroma and flavor. Typical porter.

Crowler poured a clear reddish amber with a small lasting creamy ivory head. Aromas of oak, caramel, citrus and a hint of pine. Palate was light bodied and smooth with a dry finish. Flavors of oak, caramel, pine and citrus with a smooth dry bitter lingering oak finish.

Beer Names: D9 Tropi Culture Pineapple Juicy IPA
Reviews: can - nice golden color. Decent tropical hop aroma and flavor. Tastes old but no date on can.

500 ml. bottle poured a clear gold with a small lingering white head. Aromas of straw, funk, white grapes, light oak and light pepper. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a dry tart finish. Flavors of straw, white grapes, funk, light pepper and a hint of oak with a crisp dry tart finish.
chocolate pumpkin pie latte. Semi-sweet, Ok balance. I like pumpkin stouts so this was up my alley
